description: Buy the Specialized Recon 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Recon 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Recon 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These shoes are stiff and efficient for pedaling while still comfortable to walk in. I haven't had issues with hot spots, but they do cause a bit of tingling if ratcheted too tightly. I use them for both gravel and XC mountain biking. 

My experience with these shoes is that they are NOT true to size. I am a size 6.5 or 7 women's in some brands, and ended up returning the size 37 because they were too big. I had to order the size 36 through Specialized's website because they were the only ones that carried that small of a size.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody:
I wore this shoe 3 times (over 100 miles) and was extremely disappointed. Not only did they cause hot spots, but the tongue of the shoe works its way towards your toes. If you tighten the boa to try and keep the tongue from sliding down, you cut off your blood circulation. Horrible shoe!

Thank you Backcountry for allowing me to return them. This is why I shop Backcountry; they are a great company with an excellent return policy.
review.name: Awful Shoe Unless You Like Hotspots

review.reviewBody:
This shoe looks good and works well.  Overall, I am very happy with these shoes and give them 4 out of 5 stars.  Giving 4.5 might be more accurate.

I have found that despite being stiff on the pedals, they are comfortable to walk in.  Though I've not yet had to do a serious hike-a-bike, the soles look just wide enough to provide stability.  They're certainly more substantial than "classic" XC shoes.  More sneaker-like shoes will very likely be wider, especially at the heel.

The Boa lacing has worked well and did not loosen over the course of rides.  Break-in time for riding is quick - my fifth use of them was a seven hour ride and I had no pressure nor sore points.  For walking, the shoe might need more time to fit like old blue jeans.

With regard to sizing, my feet are "low volume", somewhat narrow, and I use a Specialized insole for arch support.  The fit seems true to size - I usually wear a 10.5 US and the 44 European fits me well.  The Boa laces provide the majority of the snugness and the tongue provide good padding for the laces.  My toes have plenty of room in width and height.  This has worked out well and will allow me to wear thicker socks when cold weather arrives.

The construction seems to be good though I haven't used (abused) them long enough to know for certain.  My size 44s are about 410 grams (14.5 ounces) per shoe, with my insoles and SPD cleats.  With regard to foot protection, I suspect that they provide moderate protection.  The toe area is stiffened, but like most other shoes, the sides are effectively a single layer.

I think these are a great option for everything from gravel to modern XC and marathon.  If they were stolen from me today, I would buy them again tomorrow.
review.name: Form and Function

name: Recon 2.0 Mountain Bike Shoe

hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Rialto Fleece Lined Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, durable , comfortable, perfect size cuff to fit snugly over boots
review.name: Great winter pant

review.reviewBody: First off, these things are seriously awesome. Calling them fleece lined is a bit confusing, before they arrived I thought there'd be two layers of fabric, one for the weatherproof shell and one for the warm fleece. Nope, these are a single layer, and it's awesome how they get so much performance out of a fabric. Warmth is great, had them out in 40 degree temperatures and felt nice and warm. The waterproofing is also great, the DWR coating repelled all the water from bring in the rain for over an hour. These will be my new favorite pants for traveling, as well as for winter sports. The built in belt is functional, the only complaint is that for the price I'd prefer an aluminum buckle over plastic.
review.name: The perfect outdoor and travel pants

name: Rialto Fleece Lined Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Like the wide fit. Got my normal size. Can wear hiking socks comfortably. Seems to stick well on sandy trail, and have enough support for a rocky trail. Not hard core but good for day hikes and stylish enough for everyday jaunts in the rain with the dog! Waterproof so far!

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Low B-Dry Wide Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife. they are not wide, too small
review.name: not wide

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Low B-Dry Wide Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Pay attention as these are WIDE. I wanted the normal width but missed that they were the WIDE version in the description. I'm used to seeing the wide with the size such as 8W. My mistake. But I do love the shoe in normal width. For me, I can walk miles in them where I can't in any other shoes. Stock up.
review.name: These are WIDE. Love the shoes.

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Low B-Dry Wide Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered a 9.5 W and it was comfortable. I typically don't take a W but I did so based on the reviews because I have bunions. These are nice looking for hiking boots.
review.name: comfortable and cute

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Low B-Dry Wide Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: A nice looking & probably well constructed shoe.  However, their “wide” sizing does not accommodate my wider foot.  My feet are not exceptionally wide - I just think Oboz idea of “wide” really means:  not narrow.
review.name: Di

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Low B-Dry Wide Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I have always loved Oboz shoes, because of how supportive they are. The insole they throw in every shoe seems to make all the difference. But what I love the most about this particular shoe is how lightweight it is. Even though they are lightweight, they still feel sturdy enough to protect my feel on the trail.

I initially bought them to be my lightweight hikers, but loved the fit and the look so much that I found myself wearing them all around town. They are such a versatile shoe because not only do they have great grip on the trail, but also the road. I'd highly recommend these shoes!
review.name: Lightweight, Supportive, & Cute!

name: Sapphire Low B-Dry Wide Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: A bit of a style change for me from my "usual" Merrell footwear.  But, no change to the footbed comfort and flexibility.  I love the multi-color option!
review.name: Color, waterproof foot comfort
comment: Thanks for sharing your great feedback!

review.reviewBody: I'm very disappointed with my 2nd pair I've received. This is my 2nd pair I purchase. The build quality is NOTHING like my previous pair at all the build quality is horrible and they're supposed to be for people with wide feet but these aren't at all. I would've rather bought these for full price than buy them on,sale and receive a completey useless pair of shoes that I will have to recycle.
review.name: Quality different
comment: We are sorry to hear these did not work out for you, but we appreciate your feedback. If we can help with a return please give us a call at 800-288-3124.

review.reviewBody: I have been very pleased with these shoes, they are waterproof (the water beads on the exterior and no wet socks inside), they also grip the trail like no other, even on mud and wet leaves, my footing was solid. They were snug fitting, although loosening the shoelaces helped a lot and I could even wear with two layers of socks for walking on snowy trails, although I don't think I even needed the extra pair as my feet were warm even out in the snow (and these are not the "winter" style), and yet I feel they keep my feet a comfortable temperature even in warmer weather.
review.name: Very Pleased
comment: Thank you for your great feedback, Kelly!

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a replacement for a 13 year old Outdoor Research rain jacket and it’s a great upgrade. Took it out on a rainy windy PNW hike and stayed dry and warm. The 3 later design feels much nicer and meant it was very breathable even with the rain protection.
review.name: Great buy, dry and comfy

review.reviewBody: Items were delivered as described and performed well in sub 0F hiking
review.name: Great product and great seller!

review.reviewBody: Bought this on sale from a third party.  Well constructed, smooth sealed zipper function and seemingly durably material.  Have a Rab raincoat which does not have the same degree of durability.  Had the opportunity to wear this in a variety of rainy conditions over the last 3 weeks.  Remained dry with no wet through after 70 minutes of light to moderate steady rain.  The must have chest pocket kept electronics dry throughout.  I am 5’8” 152 lbs and range between small or medium depending on cut.  This coat seems to a slightly fitted cut and the small fit fine with room for a base layer and either micro puff vest or jacket with still plenty of room for movement.  Large vents are bidirectional.  Small criticism of all rain coats of this version would be the lack of lining/light pil on the inside front of the jacket when it is fully zipped - the fabric can get a little harsh around your chin/mouth.  Light weight and readily packable.  Not yet sure what the DWR retreat rate will be but mfg specs suggest using Nikwax wash/treat products.  To date, a nice light weight, waterproof shell.   So far, 5 stars.
review.name: Solid Jacket

review.reviewBody: I haven't used the jacket yet, but the material and construction look great (as expected from OR).  I only wish that this one was packable into one of the pockets like the last OR raincoat I am replacing.
review.name: Pleased so far - wish it was packable.

review.reviewBody:
Excellent jacket. Like the material, fit and craftsmanship. Ordered it with pricey overnight shipping. That did not happen. Received it days late after I had already left town. I was abandoned on a Backcountry chat trying to cancel the order since no one would be around to receive the package. So, I called in to cancel. The rep told me they would recall the shipment from FedEx. That did not happen. I called in again and another rep told me they would never recall a shipment and did not recall this one. 

Abandoned. Misled. Missed shipment. Unacceptable.

I'll be buying elsewhere going forward.
review.name: OR jacket: exceptional, Backcountry: not

name: Foray 3L Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the MSR Reactor Coffee Press Kits online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Reactor Coffee Press Kits
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Reactor Coffee Press Kits online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Beats my Moca pot for weight savings and works great for backcountry coffee.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I do my fair share of back country hiking and multiple day canoe trips. I also crave good coffee. The Reactor Coffee Press allows me to enjoy a great cup of coffee no matter where life takes me. Great product, I high recommend it.
review.name: Great Product

review.reviewBody: It wasn't until I had pressed my first coffee in this until I found that there was no way to pour it out! I guess I have an older version of the reactor, and newer versions appear to have a strainer built into the lid. Without this, there is no way to pour the coffee. This is very disappointing; I wish I had have read the reviews here before purchasing, as it appears I'm not the only one who has had this problem. I assumed it was compatible with all 1.7L reactors, as it didn't state anywhere in the description that it isn't.
review.name: Beware: Doesn't work with all Reactors

review.reviewBody: I purchased the coffee press attachment earlier this season and am very impressed. This is my preferred method of making coffee whether I am base camping, car camping or backpacking due to its portability and ability to make coffee for the entire group. I really love that the coffee press attachment can be stored inside the put with the stove and fuel. I use the 1.7L system and would highly recommend this for couples and for groups up to four people. You can check out my video on my Youtube channel Lone Crow Adventures for a detailed look at this system.
review.name: Great for trail coffee

review.reviewBody: I love this stove, but this accessory needs some work. The rubber seel has become mishaped over the years and has never worked as good as a real french press. Can't poor with plunger and rod in place. I would suggest MSR take note from other french presses and incorporate them into this accessory. I'm gonna buy a separate french presses that is light weight .
review.name: Work for a while.

review.reviewBody: Packed the Reactor on a recent boating trip. Usually I opt for the monster coffee press on river trips but on this trip I wanted something simple. The Reactor Coffee Press was super straight forward to setup and making coffee took half the time than usual. Nice product if you need coffee to get going and want to bring a french press along.
review.name: Fast way to make french press coffee in the morning

review.reviewBody: While the Reactor stove is an amazing piece of kit in its own right, the coffee press was the selling point for us. We have tried many different presses with a variety of stoves or pots, THIS is our favorite!
review.name: Selling Point

review.reviewBody: I use it with the 1.7l Version and love to brew my home ground grains with it. Everything works perfect. I even feel that I find less powder on the bottom of the Cup as with my Bodum home press. It fits nicely in the DeepDish bowl which then dissapears on the bottom of the pot. Brilliant Piece of kit.
review.name: Best Coffee outside ever had

review.reviewBody: This is by far the first MSR product that I'm not completely pleased with, poor design from top to bottom. First, the plunger is help in place by rubber that is was to flexible. Second, there's virtually no way to pour the coffee without trying to remove the lid.
review.name: Needs Work!

name: Reactor Coffee Press Kits

hasVariant.name: Deva 70L Backpack - Women's

hasVariant.name: Deva 70L Backpack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Deva 70L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: XS, The most comfortable pack I have worn for carrying heavier loads 40-60pnds. Lots of handy pockets and great material. The little bit of extra weight compared to other packs is definitely worth it.
review.name: Great women’s pack for heavier loads

review.reviewBody: I finally got a new backpacking bag, and decided to go with the Gregory Deva 70. I have quite a short torso, and the flexibility and comfort with this pack is unmatched. So happy with this purchase!
review.name: Incredible!

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack for its high reviews and two features: the integrated rain cover and reservoir sleeve that turns into a daypack. However, when I received my Deva 70L, it had neither of those features. (I bought the eggplant color.) Backcountry customer service couldn't tell me why so I went directly to Gregory, who quickly told me they did away with those two features in the newest Deva 70L version. If those features don't matter to you, this is a great pack. I'd suggest Backcountry update its description so other customers can avoid this headache.
review.name: Incorrect website description

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've tried on a few bags around the 70-75L range from Osprey and Black Diamond on multi-day backpacking trips and so far this one is my favorite for fit and best weight distribution/suspension system. I carry on average 40+ pounds on my trips and have noticed how much more comfortable my Gregory Deva 70 pack is on my back than other packs.

Other convenient features I really appreciate are:
- the side pocket for actual ease of removing a 32oz water bottle without having to take my pack off
- the plethora of front / side pockets for stashing various items
- U-shaped front zipper to open up the entire inside of the bag instead of having to top-load
- large zipper loop design that make it easy to access different parts of the pack
- sturdy back support
- included rain cover

I only have a few critiques for what I wish for that would make it perfect:
- better colors for women (I really like the men's colors)
- a keychain loop inside one of the top compartments and a small zippered money pocket for safekeeping the important stuff
- maybe a couple external daisy chains to carabiner stuff to
- perhaps having an integrated daypack as the pack's brain

Full disclosure: I received this product as a gift in exchange for a review, but these are my own words and honest opinion and I would 100% recommend the pack. After a couple of trips I'm already confident that it's the best amongst the packs I own and I've already sold off the rest. I love the Deva 70 and it's definitely a keeper for me!

#giftedproduct
review.name: Impressive Backpacking Pack

review.reviewBody: After having done extensive research for the perfect backpacking pack the Gregory wins! It has all the pockets I need, great access, comfortable straps and hip belt and adjusts to my body very easily. Super light. Love this pack!
review.name: Deva 70

review.reviewBody:
#giftedproduct 
The women's Deva 70L is my go-to for any time I go backpacking in the backcountry. The new updated suspension system makes carrying my essentials a breeze and I feel full freedom of movement during long hikes. I highly recommend this pack! It's an award winner for a reason!
review.name: AMAZING Pack for Long Excursions!

review.reviewBody:
This pack is perfect!  I took it for 7 nights in the Sequoia/Kings Canyon backcountry, and it exceeded my expectations in comfort - even though I was carrying more than 1/3 of my body weight.  Everything fit nicely, even my giant bear canister, and I am one to bring a ton of clothes and carry all my own gear, tent, hammock, book, etc.  I highly recommend this pack.  If you are debating between this pack and the Kalmia, I recommend this one - I have used both!  (I am 5'8", 140lbs, and athletic build.)

As a recent convert to the Gregory brand, I just have to say: POCKETS!  This pack has great pockets, which is lacking in so many other brands.  The bottom zip-off compartment even has a divider to keep your sleeping bag and other items separate and accessible.  The dual front zip pockets are perfect for storing incidentals, and there are multiple internal and external pockets in the brain too.  The best though are the hip belt pockets - I could store my large phone, sunglasses, snacks, and TP all comfortably!  This alone will make me never go back to the brand I used for nearly a decade before switching to the Deva.

My other favorite feature was the clip to secure my reservoir hose (though I do wish they had the clip on each side - it is only on one, but minor issue).  This was lacking on my last pack, and I don't know how I lived without it!

Overall, great pack, great company!
review.name: Love this pack!!

name: Deva 70L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: These are really nice shorts but Competitive Cyclist’s size chart isn’t close to reality. Instead, I suggest you visit Giordana’s own website for their sizing, which is completely different (and correct).
review.name: CC’s size chart is way off!

review.reviewBody:
have purchased 2 pair of these shorts They are really comfortable, fit great, ( I am 5'6' & 170 lbs) however, both pair had to be returned. one to company and one to competitive cyclist.
Reason is the seem to the right front panel ripped apart after only a few months, I would think that foe this Price $$$ they would last a couple years. I have a pair of Trek shorts , paid less than 100 for them 3 years ago they are still in very good condition!! I finally got my last pair of the FR-C pro shorts and got 2 years out of them , but they are coming apart in the same area.
would not spend this much money nor would I recommend them!!
review.name: don

review.reviewBody: Bought the blue ones quite a while ago because they were blue. I've worn them constantly since and I've got a drawer full of shorts. Bought a black pair not long ago. Top shelf. Extremely comfortable. Yes, they have a waist band, and yes, it rolls down, and yes, it's annoying for about 15 seconds.
review.name: Own two pair ...

review.reviewBody: I am a mountain biker and I use these FR-C Pro shorts as a base layer under Eddie Bauer First Ascent Men's 12 Inch Guide Shorts. I do a lot of climbing and was sick and tired of the burning coming out of my rear-end wearing so-called mountain biking shorts with worthless barely padded, itchy inserts. The fit on these shorts is great, the cushioning is plush, and they are not hot.
review.name: Great for Mountain Biking

name: FR-C Pro Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this to go with a pair of smartwool base layer bottoms. The top is very cozy and warm. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Warm, soft, and comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am a 38C and usually wear an athletic bra that flattens my chest. I am usually a size M and sometimes a L. I sized up to a L and am happy with the fit. It's extra long in sleeves and length, but not baggy.
review.name: Perfect fit - size up!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was excited to see the yellow color (marmalade heather), so even though I have lots of long underwear I bought this also. When I received it though the color is not yellow at all. It is solidly orange. So I am going to be returning the top along with the matching bottoms.
review.name: Color is off

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’m on the heavier side (5’3 173) I ordered a large and it fits great. Warm but not suffocating hot. I plan to buy more. I wear it almost daily for bed.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This is a little thicker than my thinner, finer gauged merino baselayers from other famous brands.  All have lasted for years, indeed I'm wearing one now, though this past summer moths ate pinholes and larger in some, despite camphor in the closets!  It's not those other brands' fault, and I keep them mended, too. But you can kind of see the mends and either wear them under other stuff or for gardening.

So, this new baselayer from Smartwool is a delight!  Yummy thickness, not too thick, and refreshingly clean and new.  I don't need to hide it under stuff but I can if I want to on a cold day.  Haven't washed it yet.

Must try harder to fight moths this spring!
review.name: Yummy and pretty

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I live in a warm weather area and travelled to ICELAND!   I got this baselayer especially for the trip and it definitely came through for me (along with a few other layers)!  Warm, soft, comfortable.
review.name: Did what I needed it to

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: love these - i've tried other baselayers but they get holey and stretch out and don't last - my smartwool shirts and heavier knits have lasted for years, happy to have a couple new ones - love the new purple too
review.name: smartwool wins

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I cannot say enough good things about this base layer, the quality of the wool truly shines through. I used to steer clear of wool until I realized it was low quality wool I needed to stay away from!  I have used this base layer this whole 23-24 season here in Utah, it has been my do it all layer, I am still wearing it here in April, we just had a storm over the weekend, and this came in so handy. You need this in every color! It pairs so nicely with the Classic Thermal Merino Baselayer Bottom.

#Backcountry Gearhead
review.name: Look no further for the perfect layer!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: Kept my wife warm while skiing. She felt the wool was a little itchy but wasn’t a problem. Overall would recommend to anyone needing a warm baselayer.
review.name: Very warm

review.itemreviewed: Classic Thermal Merino Crew Baselayer - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for my March ski trip in Park City, Utah. It was extremely warm and sometimes too warm at the base of the mountain. I have been in search of a good quality base layer and this one is superior to any of the others I have previously tried.
review.name: Perfect for skiing

review.reviewBody: I like the shoe. Was hesitant since there is no way to “try it on” given that if I didn’t like it I would need to return it at my shipping expense. Wasn’t a fan of that fact. Turns out, it did fit well. But…….i bought the navy blue. I wore them one day with no show Sox and at the end of the day the blue dye colored all of the toes. Not only were my Sox stained blue but it went through and stained my toe nails navy blue as well! Sure wasn’t expecting that, and no I did not have unusually sweaty feet wearing them. I’ve never experienced that with any shoe ever. Now I hate to wear them. I’m going to need to figure out what to do next. So……they are comfortable, but this blue dye thing is a disaster. It’s not that easy to scrub blue dye off your toe nails.
review.name: Comfortable…but……

review.reviewBody: I wear these shoes every chance I get. I wanted to get away from wearing shoes that squeeze my feet all day like vans and nike's, so naturally Vivobarefoot was the answer. I have worn my pair for almost a year and a half now every single day and they are still kicking. Build quality and comfort is unmatched. My toes have plenty of room to breathe and wiggle while feeling natural and not clunky. These shoes are on my feet at the office, gym, out to eat... really anywhere I go they go. Sizing is spot on. They do take a few wears to really break in, but once they do, they never come off I recommend these shoes to anyone who is looking for a HIGH QUALITY minimalist/barefoot shoe.
review.name: My everyday shoes

name: Primus Lite Knit Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have worn these twice trail running. I bought them to keep my legs warm on cold morning trail runs. When the temp was below 40°, my legs still got pretty cold in these tights despite doing hill runs. They were great when the temp was over 40° during my other run. Very comfortable and stayed put. Nice side zipper pocket.
review.name: Comfortable tights

review.reviewBody: Super warm leggings! Although I wore them for a few days and the backside is completely pilled. I've had them for a month and hope they last...
review.name: Warm yet pills easily

review.reviewBody: These tights were just what I was after for walking. Lovely and comfortable but very disappointingly they quickly looked tired and tatty, covered in bobbles after only a few weeks.
review.name: H Foster

review.reviewBody: I love these tights, perfect for shoulder season hiking. Unfortunately I found that they got bobbles all over them and now they look old and worn even though I've only had them for about 8 weeks. :-(
review.name: So comfortable and could wear them everyday.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable on, promote ease of movement. Will resist a light shower, haven't tried them out in heavier rain.
review.name: Very comfortable on, promote ease

review.reviewBody: Great fit, warm, love the look of the heather colour, leg length perfect! Had to order more as I practically live in them!
review.name: Great fit, warm, love the

review.reviewBody: A goreat pair of tights. They are slightly tighter on the thigh on the leg with the pocket, and the patches behind the knees get cold in strong winds. Good water shedding. It would be great to see these in a short length.
review.name: A goreat pair of tights.

review.reviewBody: Pilling on both thighs and all I’ve done is walked in them. No scrabbling up any mountains. Very poor performance which is a shame as they are lovely and comfortable and warm
review.name: Pilling on both thighs and

review.reviewBody:
True to size bought large 5’11” 190lb 33in athletic build 
Everything about this jacket is great except it’s narrow around the hips especially when sitting down. Wishing it fit better. Returned
review.name: Tight around the hips

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: I wore the Arc'teryx Alpha SV for years and loved it. I bought this jacket this year and wore it heli-skiing in Valdez and recently in Iceland during a 2-day wind and rain storm. The ranger later told us that the gusts hit 100 km/hr. I was dry and "comfortable" given the conditions. Its ventilation is better than the Alpha bc of its front vent. Its pit zips are so long that you can put your hands where the pockets would be. This is the best rain jacket I've worn. Period.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: This was a great jacket for long backcountry days. Loved the large pit zips and the chest vent for when it gets a little toasty on the skin track. Also loved that the chest vent had velco which made it quick and easy to access a beacon on the inside of the jacket. The fabric itself felt on the lighter side, but stood up to any abuse I put it through. It also allowed plenty of movement which I loved. I'm 6'0", about 195lbs, and have about a 6'1" wingspan. I'm normally in-between a Large and an XL. Went with the XL which didn't feel super baggy on me and still have enough room for some layers.
review.name: Great for long backcountry days!

review.reviewBody:
I agree with another review that mentions it as utilitarian.
I disagree with the comment that mentions it runs small. I found it baggy/true-to-size. I normally wear shmediums, and this felt a bit long/baggy in a medium. However, if temps dropped and it was brutally cold, I felt I could wear a burly puffy underneath and still have movement.

-It feels bombproof, like the Backcountry Cardiac jacket, so it should last a very long time if taken care of.
-Nice, adjustable powder skirt
-Hood that actually fits over a helmet for extra warmth.
-Little pass holder within the arm pocket is a nice touch.
-Pit zips are nice and large to dump heat AND a front vent to open when things get even more toasty.
-Internal phone pocket is a hair small.
-leashed lens cleaner is also a nice touch.
-The vertical pockets, while being a bit oddly located, are very accessible and nice and open nice and large, so you can access items with gloves on!

I've used it for resort/sidecountry, and a bit of touring, and works great for all.
review.name: Hits the Mark

review.reviewBody:
-- TL;DR --
Great shell but size up because it runs small.

-- PROS --
- This jacket is a pretty decent shell and keeps me dry in any weather condition I wear it in.
- The construction is top-notch
- This is the first jacket in which the wrist gaiters don't pinch my hand because of the longer sleeves

-- CONS --
- Size up because it runs small
- You won't be able to unzip the jacket from the bottom since there's no secondary zipper on the main/body zipper.
- The placement of the pockets are a little strange

Note for the backcountry.com admins: The name of the color for the red jacket is misspelled. It should be "Adrenaline" not "Arednalin" ;)
review.name: Decent Shell

review.reviewBody:
I have found this jacket to be extremely utilitarian. I roll it up and put it in my pack for my backcountry AT and then hit the slopes and lift rides. It's all about the layering, but just a medium weight flannel and this shell make for a perfect mid 20's day at the resort. When in the backcountry, it rolls up and packs as good as would be expected for a jacket of this build. 

Let's talk about the build. The zippers being fully sealed is great and have yet to get a mis-zip out of any of the zippers. The recycled 3L Gore-Tex Pro fabric is top notch. I can see how these products will last a long time. Especially with the Norrona brand and their repair center in Norway. Yes you may be without your garment for some time while it goes back to its headquarters in Norway to get the TLC it may need. Because Norrona stands behind their products (check out their YouTube Channel). It is getting repaired by highly skilled seamsters and seamstresses. They design their products to last you a lifetime and want you to be proud of owning a quality piece of gear for your outdoor adventures. 

I went with a size large in the lemon chrome color; to help my partner find me on the slopes and to be seen in the backcountry. I am 5'10" and weight 190 atm and it fits me very well. The powder skirt fits snuggly against my hips and waist; as it should. The powder skirt is removable if you plan to spend a chill day on the groomers for a little bit of a more relaxed feel. The left arm pocket for your pass works really well; at least at my home resort of Steamboat. The breast pockets work well for snacks, sunglasses, goggles, or what-have-you. The left breast pocket has a microfiber lens cloth and there is an internal pocket that appears to be designed for your beacon should you be touring in the backcountry with a beacon device. 

Buying into Norrona is buying into sustainability, eco-minded, and quality. At its price; it is definitely an investment. In my opinion it is a good investment because you are buying these additional aspects when buying Norrona. And is a piece you can have for life.
review.name: Great all arounder

review.reviewBody: I?ve used this jacket numerous days this past winter, resort skiing in the Wasatch. I love the design, great pocket placement, perfect hood (fits over the helmet without constraining the neck yet stays over), perfect length of the jacket and sleeves. Jacket is very light yet it performed perfectly in all the different conditions.
review.name: Awesome jacket
comment: Interested in the jacket and I?m the same size as you. I found that the waist fits tightly. I wear size 32 pants for context. Have you found it restricting while skiing?

review.reviewBody: Lightweight but tough.  I live and ski in the Sierra Nevadas and the weather can be very wet.  This jacket kept me out on the hill in even the toughest conditions.  You won't appreciate how amazing this hood is until you've tried it out.  Best hood ever!  Sleeves extend over the top of the glove adding extra moisture protection in a great touch.  Easiest pulling "pit zips" I've ever had, which matters.  Bottom line, I ski every day (over 200 days this season) and this jacket still looks good, the color hasn't faded (which often happens in our intense California sunshine), and it still beads water like it did back in November.  I like a more relaxed fit, so I upsized, runs true to size for a more modern fit.  Highly recommended.
review.name: Takes Any Abuse
comment: you lost me at "I ski every day...."
bro you rip. i follow you on IG! I'm picking this shell up in red. hype is real

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm but after a year of owning it has gotten tighter, may want to size up to save the toes unless you can afford a new pair every year.
review.name: Unless

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots were truly impressive. My feet were very warm over the three days we were out hiking in the snow and single digits temps. Exceeded expectations.
review.name: Wow

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Got these for the wife who is always complaining about cold feet on hikes, now she is complaining because they are too warm! j/k We had a weekend outside and she didn't get cold once, very great quality as usual! Thanks Keen!
review.name: feet are warm!

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They are comfortable and the toebox is adequate despite them being a little pointier than my old Keens. What's really annoying is how bulky they are, so my winter gaiters don't fit. I literally can't overlap the velcro closure, or hook to the gaiter rindg. There also is no space under the arch for the gaiter strap, as there is under my old Keen boots. Finally, I can't get my microsoikes on these boots because of the pointier toe, so I need a larger size. When you design boots there needs to be more thought given to the various interfaces. My gaiters and spikes fit all my other size 9. 5 boots, Keen and Salomon, just not these. Get rid of that pointy toe please! If anyone else made a winter boot that didn't squish my toes I would send these boots back in a heartbeat. Having to buy new gaiters and spikes makes them an expensive boot.
review.name: Ok but not perfect

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm, tall enough,not to tall. Perfect for my needs. Keen is a brand to trust to keep your feet warm! Practical boot from walking the dog, to ice fishing. Always satisfied!
review.name: I knew I'd love it! ❤️

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love how the tongue is shaped, so that it doesn’t add a fold that presses into your shin when the boots are laced up. I have a narrow heel, but can remedy that issue by wearing thicker socks, thanks to the ample toe room these boot offer. Very comfy, and I love the treads!
review.name: No pressure points, great fit

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: On my first outing with my new boots & I slipped on a small ice patch that was disguised by a fresh snowfall, which resulted in a broken hip & shoulder—the first bone break in my life!. Choosing this boot is costing me thousands. The boots are nice looking & warm, thus the 2 stars, but they will not protect you from falling. My orthopedic surgeon has recommended a spiked boot. I wont need them until next winter, since i now can’t walk at all.
review.name: Not good on ice! Be careful!

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: When I ordered it said “runs small, order up” so I ordered 8.5 instead of 8 and it’s too big. Return process underway. They seem like they’ll be great- soft and comfy but warm and sturdy- once I get the right size!
review.name: Too big

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
These are my all time favorite winter boots !! This is my 4th season with these shoes, and I wear them daily for work, and they are still holding up great ! I live in Lake Tahoe and have definitely put them to the test. 
They still keep my feet warm, still don't smell too bad 😅, and soles aren't wearing out. I tried on a few different pairs too before I settled on these, and I'm oh so happy with my purchase. When they finally wear out I will definitely be getting another pair!
review.name: Best winter boots

review.itemreviewed: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: From Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Today was the first true test with these boots. We just had a massive storm last night with 25 cm of snow, then freezing rain, then rain. I have 2 big snow dogs that need a good 5 km run so I did a lot of research before buying these boots. I needed to make sure that the boots could withhold my needs, as I'm outside a lot during the winter. Well they keep my feet warm, are good walking in the snow but on ice be careful. I was hoping this traction technology on the boots would be enough for me not to wear my ice grippers but if it's really icy outside, I think I'll still wear the ice grippers. I had a few cold puddles to walk through so that tested the waterproof aspect. Mind you, my feet were warm but my socks were a bit damp when I took off my boots. I wouldn't recommend a long walk in deep puddles with these boots. Overall, I'm satisfied with them so far. I love my Keen hiking shoes so I said why not try out the boots. I did order half a size up for my thicker winter socks and they fit great. I would say true to size. I would recommend these to a friend, especially the hiking shoes.
review.name: Women's Revel High Polar Boots

name: Revel IV High Polar Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Utility Jogger - Women's
review.reviewBody: So happy with these pants! Great for climbing. So happy mtn hardware is making women’s pants that stay up, are not tight on the thighs, and come in fun colors.
review.name: Amazing pants

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Utility Jogger - Women's
review.reviewBody: pants seem like they would be amazing, unfortunately cannot try them out or return bc there is no drawstring to keep the waist up.  Mountain hardwear needs to make more XXS sizes so they don't constantly sell out in every single color, or at the very least add a drawstring to their pants!!!! how can you expect everyone to have the same waist? crazy.
review.name: need drawstring

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Utility Jogger - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great pants. A friend purchased them first and I loved them so much I bought a pair too.  I may go back and get another pair in a different color.  I am height challenged and these pants fit my 5'4" frame great.
review.name: Awesome Pants

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Utility Jogger - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable. Loose fitting and lightweight.Perfect for travel days, hanging at home or out & about.
review.name: lightweight & comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Utility Jogger - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these pants!   Perfect for hiking, extremely well made and practical.  Glad I bought two pairs and tempted to buy more.
review.name: Well made, extremely practical for movement, and flattering

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Utility Jogger - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable, true to size fit, easy to pull on and off, wash and hang well. Easily accessible pockets. Gave 4 stars because there is some wrinkling after drying.
review.name: Easy to wear, comfortable movement with the banded waist, and loose in thighs

review.itemreviewed: Dynama High Rise Utility Jogger - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of the joggers. I love almost everything about them. At 5’3” and 112 lbs., I need extra small for the pants to stay up, but the are at least 1.5” too short, so the legs constantly ride up my shins. These joggers would be perfect if you would offer them in a loner inseam!
review.name: Too short for slim women

name: Dynama High Rise Utility Jogger - Women's

It's been great for cold winter Denver days and weekend trips up to the mountains where she loves to be outside romping in the snow!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's so adorable! I got it for my 6 month old granddaughter who was accompanying her parents on a winter trip to Boulder and Santa Fe. Since she has no words yet, she couldn't tell me how warm and comfortable the parka is...her first North Face! But she matched her mom, who was also wearing North Face, and had a great time in her first winter outing in the cold. She did not complain...so she must have been comfortable! And she sure looked cute!
review.name: A real North Face, just like mom!

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Ferrosi Skort - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ferrosi Skort - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Ferrosi Skort - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love the color, pockets, length, It fits a bit small in the waist, Wish I had got a larger size.
review.name: Nice Skort.

review.reviewBody: Nice short, Fits small, It was final sale so a waste of &&
review.name: Cute but too small

review.reviewBody: I like this skort - nice and light. I wore it almost every day in the hot Mediterranean summer. My only complaint is the front pockets - not deep enough, or secure. I didn't keep important things there, but things kept falling out. It would be nice to be able to safely keep a phone in a front pocket. Comfortable though.
review.name: Nice, light skort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have 3 of the former style of this same skort and purchased 2 this time and I do like them but I prefer the old style with the zipper and button front.
review.name: Great Skort but loved the old style more.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's nice overall, just a bit hot for the thigh!
review.name: Overall comfortable but a bit hot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my skort! Purchased two of them. They are very comfortable and easy to care for. Highly recommend.
review.name: Skort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have multiple of these and they are so comfortable!
review.name: Best hiking and golf skorts!

review.reviewBody: I check this website repeatedly in hopes of seeing that the older style with front zip and belt loops has magicallyreturned. My favorites are the really old ones with the zip pocket low on the left side. As an outdoor person and also someone who travels A LOT, the older skorts gave me exactly what I needed to feel casual but polished. I've directed lots of women to your brand over the years! The new style is way to informal for my use. I keep combing other websites looking for a replacement, and trying to protect the old ferrosis I still have.
review.name: Please bring back the older style!

review.reviewBody: I bought this skort in orange after enjoying the Ferrosi hiking pants and wanting something for the hotter months. This is my new favourite summer clothing item. I wear it every weekend, and have even worn it to the office for casual Fridays. I get compliments every time I'm out, with folks commenting on how sporty, cute and comfortable it looks. It's breathable for day-hiking in sticky, humid sun and looks put together enough to stop at a beer garden afterwards. I'm looking forward to buying more colours.
review.name: My favourite summer clothing item

review.reviewBody: I was so excited for new colors this year only to find the design has changed. IMO the new design appears unpolished, too casual and visually unappealing. What I liked about the old styling was being able to work in the elements yet look polished enough for a meeting. This new design is simply too casual looking and just visually not very attractive. Please, please, please bring back the old Ferrosi skort.
review.name: Excited for New Season Colors But

name: Ferrosi Skort - Women's

description: Buy the Fox Racing Ranger Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ranger Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fox Racing Ranger Short - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Love the short length just above the knee caps and fitted legs, the fabric is stretchy and light and it breaths great during hot rides.  The big downside is the waist, for some reason they use an additional black fabric, a sort of mesh lining the waist, that it's not elastic at all, it has zero give.

I'm a skinny 28" and the short fits well, but when I'm moving around on the bike and because there's no zipper on the fly and it just have a single snap button, it snaps open everytime I expand my abdomen!

If the waist was made of the main elastic fabric only, it would have some give and it would be fine, but it's not.  So make sure the size you choose is slightly larger, otherwise if you choose the exact size, you might have the same problem I have.
review.name: Unforgiving waist

review.reviewBody: I just ordered these. great fit, but the stitching has begun to unravel. After 15 years of Fox shorts....
review.name: Fox slippin

review.reviewBody: I bought these purely for the color of the shorts and I've had ranger shorts in the past.  Shorts are nice.  I like them and look good off the bike too.  The chamois on the other hand is as useful as just stuffing a single tissue in your shorts in terms of comfort on your delicates.  Previous chamois' that are several years old feel better than this one new on the ol' wedding tackle.
review.name: Chamois hurts my bits and pieces

review.reviewBody: First of all, I have multiple other Fox shorts, as well as other brands. This particular model is a material with some elastic to it. No issue specifically with it being elastic, but the material seems a little grippy with the seat. It makes it difficult to mount the bike, and when I was in front of the saddle it got stuck making it impossible to get back on the saddle. Seems to be more of an issue when it is damp, but that will be the case all summer with sweat. I am not exaggerating when I say for the duration of the ride I hated these shorts.
review.name: Material is a problem

review.reviewBody: WHY Do they have a snap-on button? WHYYYY???  Everything else is good with these shorts. BUT, and this is a big BUT, the snap-on button just comes loose super easily. Every time I put my hands in my pocket to grab my phone. Every time I need to accommodate my hip-pack. It's just not meant to work with MTB activities. As a reference, they are loose on me. I promise is not a tight belly issue.
review.name: Bad design. Wrong button selection

review.reviewBody: This is probably my third pair of Ranger shorts and I keep coming back to them as my preferred shorts for biking.  They are simple and to the point and the 32 fits me just as well as other size 32 pants and shorts.  The liner that comes with these is very nice as well.  For a pair of bike shorts that won?t break the bank you can?t go wrong with the Rangers.
review.name: Keep coming back to these

review.reviewBody:
To say that I was underwhelmed by these shorts would be an epic understatement.  These are some of the most poorly designed mountain biker shorts I've ever tried. The first is issues is these are longer than described in Backcountry's listing. 

Secondly, the liner short is laughably weak for a short of this price, with thin chamois that isn't very effective at tamping vibration, and the waistband lack sufficient elasticity to keep them up when you ride. They also lack compression in the legs.

The outer short portion is even more poorly designed, with a too slim (vertically) waistband and the cinch straps don't stay where you adjust, loosening constantly while you ride, leaving you having to frequently pull the shorts back up and re-cinch them - the adjustment straps would be better with a locking cam on them, or just make them Velcro so they don't slip.

Definitely do not recommend these, they're awful.
review.name: Wow these are badly designed
comment: I have never heard or seen anyone rating a liner for vibration damping characteristics... guess there's always a first

review.reviewBody: I own two older models of this short that fit me perfectly.  I'm 5'10" 145lbs, cyclist build.  I don't like baggy clothes.  Fox just went with the trend of Fattening America and seemingly just sized up across the line.  Size Sm that used to fit me perfectly now just fits like all the garbage enduro-brah stuff out there.  Waist is bigger and inseam is longer.  Returning... the search continues.  Also really don't like that the waist adjustment is external and visible.  Adds an additional element of cheapness to the product.  Previous models had internal velcro size fitment.   I didn't notice that in the pics when ordering the black color.
review.name: Not the same as the older models
comment: i'm 5'9" 150lbs, and usually wear about a 29"-30" pant and i just ordered these in a 30" and they were a little big in the waist and long on me as well.  Debating on ordering the 28" and crossing my fingers the fit is a little better.

name: Ranger Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Works as advertised. The internal stand takes a bit of getting used to the first time, but then is quick. Use it for my 60cm road bike and need to remove the seat post. Good protection.
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody: We bought these bags because we'd been borrowing them from a friend and decided it was time to own them - The engineering is brilliant and they work great -
review.name: These Bags are the Best!

review.reviewBody: This would be the fourth EVOC bike bag purchased. The redesign of the integrated bike stand seems excellent. There is difficulty in sliding the fiberglass stays all the way down into the  case.  I am very much questioning the longevity of the case since the material seems lighter than the previous travel case.  The zipper is less robust and does not zip it smoothly as my previous case, which my son is now using, nor the zippers on my wife’s case, which is the same generation.  So, although the design is excellent, the price has increased, and the quality may be diminished. Time will tell.
review.name: Great design. Durability questionable

review.reviewBody:
I've had a lot of bike bags and this is hands down the best I've used. I've traveled all over with road, gravel, xc, and enduro bikes and never had any issues packing everything in (the enduro bike to push the weight limits for airline fees). It's great to be able to break it down in a small size so you can fit the built bike and the bag in a rental car. I've also never had any issues with damage (knock on wood), which I can't say for other cases. It's much more secure than it looks and feels. 

I did see the negative review re: installing the struts. I did have a similar (well, not to that extent) frustration installing the struts. It does take a little work the first time but pretty smooth install beyond that. The key is just to make sure there's no slack and don't get caught up on the plastic base.
review.name: Best option on the market

name: Bike Travel Bag Pro

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was interested in a light white sweater for Colorado late fall weather, this checked all the boxes. I didn’t give it a 5 star because I followed their sizing guide and ordered a (L) that is my normal size 5’7 170 athletic build. The fit is a little too boxy and the neck keeps pulling towards the back and I have to keep pulling it down (even with the front tuck).
It’s beautiful and very luxurious. I may have sized down for a slimming fit but I’m afraid it wouldn’t look right.
review.name: Gorgeous sweater slightly too boxy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sweater will look good with jeans or dressed up! The fit is great. I’m 5’5” 135.
review.name: This sweater will look good

review.reviewBody: The fabric is a really nice weight and has a lovely drape. As someone who is quite sensitive to wool, I am so happy with how this feels next to my skin - not itchy at all. I chose to order a large instead of my usual medium because I wanted it to have a looser fit. I’d say the larger size looks just a bit looser on me than the sweater appears on the model but I’m quite happy with it.
review.name: Beautiful, comfortable knit

review.reviewBody: Love the color and cut of this sweater. Just the right thickness so its light but also warm without being bulky.
review.name: Love the color and cut

review.reviewBody: Straight to the point. Lightweight and good size. Even if you don't have a specific need/use for these (i.e. I bought these specifically to organize and hold my stoppers/nuts), these come in handy in so many ways.
review.name: No Fuss Ovals

review.reviewBody: I thought they’d be a bit heavier but they’re great. Bomber
review.name: Bomber Biners

review.reviewBody: These are great for all-around use. These worked well and arrived quickly. May need a few more.
review.name: Great set.

review.reviewBody: They work great for their intended purpose, from hanging gear off of my wildland web gear, to having spare carabiners for rope rescue.
These are great, sturdy, light beaners that are lighter compared to others of the same  size as well and have a large base to hold a large load.
These are smooth operating & lightweight. Always good to have extra!
review.name: GREAT CARIBINERS

review.reviewBody: You can not get any better than the best! Use these things for pretty much everything in my aid setup. Their size is perfect and are true ovals, unlike some other brands. Used in the right setting and for the right purpose, I would not use anything else. I wish BD still sold their wire gate ovals, but these new key lock solid gates were a pleasant surprise. Just bought another pack!
review.name: The Best

review.reviewBody: Love using these ovals for clipping extra equipment to my harness during long multi pitches
review.name: Racking carabiner

hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Mari Crop Top - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This tank is incredibly comfortable, made from soft, breathable fabric that feels great against the skin. The cropped length is just right, hitting at the perfect spot to pair with high-waisted leggings or shorts. Whether I'm heading out for a hike or just lounging at home, this tank is my go-to. It's stylish, functional, and a fantastic addition to my wardrobe. Highly recommend!
review.name: Comfortable and Perfect cropped length

review.reviewBody: Bought an XL and the band is too large but the coverage of the cups is too scanty. Not every woman is a small A cup like your models. When you increase around the chest, please add more material for coverage in the cup area as well.
review.name: Mari Crop Top

review.reviewBody: I love this colorful bra top. It is not too compress my already flat breast yet supportive enough.
review.name: what a cute top

review.reviewBody: I love this so much! I bought one, then ended up buying 2 more because it was so functional and comfortable! And not to mention super cute.
review.name: Mari Crop Top

review.reviewBody: I got the large top and my boobs hang out the sides. I’m DD 😢 giving it to my daughter.
review.name: Must have small boobs

review.reviewBody: This is a nice bra for light activity like yoga, walking. The fit isn’t quite right for my bust size; it’s slightly too small and doesn’t quite cover my entire side boob. However, it’s not quite tight enough around my ribs. The fit is okay, and I can still wear it for some activities. I’m 34 C, 125 lbs and bought an XS. The material is very soft and comfortable.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I’m usually between a small and medium, using the size chart, purchased a medium. The straps are very long, probably in excess of 3” for my body. Otherwise the fabric is soft, and is comfortable.
review.name: Runs Large

review.reviewBody: It would be more honest if the description explained that this is a top that can only be used by people with smaller breasts, like size A-B. Size C or bigger should NOT purchase this product. For some reason, the sides/armpit section cuts really far into the center. I have larger C size breasts, and they kept falling out the sides of this bra. It would be really cute for someone with smaller breasts, but not for me. The fit is so strange. This could never support you in an activity. Unfortunately, it was a waste of money and can't even be used to look cute because my boobs just fall out the sides. It's a really strange fashion choice to make the sides cut in so much. It would be much better if there were 2" more of fabric on each side.
review.name: ONLY FOR SMALL BREASTS

review.reviewBody: I got an extra large (general size for tops and sports bras), and while I wouldn't say it is too big, it's definitely not made with large breasts in mind. The straps are very long and the back rises up which makes the front fall and the side boob is intense. I'll probably shorten my straps and see how it fits
review.name: Great fabric, weird fit

review.reviewBody: Comfy, but straps do not adjust and very loose on the sides.
review.name: Comfy, but straps do not

name: Mari Crop Top - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Mojo Chalk Bag online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect for small hands very nice color and embroidery logo is a plus
review.name: Perfect for small hands very

review.reviewBody: I'm newer to rock-climbing and just wanted a simple inexpensive chalk bag. This one is not only affordable but durable and of high quality.
review.name: Great Chalk Bag

review.reviewBody: Got my first chalk bag from black diamond. using it regularly at the gym, and im excited for the fall to get out on the walls with it.
review.name: Cant wait to use on the wall!

review.reviewBody: Excellent chalk bag wish it was easier to adjust but works great!
review.name: Big and Great!

review.reviewBody: Streamlined and essential chalk bag - lightweight with a convenient clip, doesn't bounce and seems to be constructed sturdily after a few uses.
review.name: Great for gym or crag

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this bag a couple of times now and it does just what I need it to do! Comfortable and lightweight
review.name: Does just what I need it to do!

review.reviewBody: Outer material is nice and rugged, it doesn’t leak in my bag. Just be sure that if you don’t specifically want small to get a large the small is just big enough to get a hand all the way in.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I have slightly large hands, and I wish it were a little bit bigger
review.name: A little small

review.reviewBody: Only critiques I had with this item is that it was smaller than I thought it would be, but that wasn't an issue it still fits an average sized chalk ball and good amount of chalk. Other slight problem is the spot where the cinch closes on the inside is a little deep into the bag, it would be a little more spacious if it cinched nearer the top, but, once again, not a major issue and works great! Recommend the larger size.
review.name: Great chalk bag, minimal issues

review.reviewBody: I was given my bag about 4 years ago. I don't use it for chalk. I climb cellphone towers and use it for just about anything! Very convenient and lasts a life time. A little wear and tear definitely time for a new one but its still going to get used as a bolt bag
review.name: The uses are endless

name: Mojo Chalk Bag

hasVariant.description: Buy the POC VPD Air Sleeve online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
If you are in between sizes, definitely size up, maybe even if you are close.  I first ordered small because I did not want them to slip down, but those were too tight, medium fit perfectly and they do not slip at all in my experience.  I ride in the high 80s and low 90s here in the desert and they are not too hot, and I get hot.  I had a huge fall that severely sprained my rotator cuff requiring two months of PT, and even though my elbow still got scraped up pretty badly, no broken elbow, and the sleeve is still in great condition, no damage to it!

Make sure you take them off carefully by the padded section as much as possible to not stretch the mesh area.  Other than that, these are great protection for a wide variety of riding and provide sun protection to boot!
review.name: Fits well, works in desert heat, durable

review.reviewBody: Overall, I’m really happy with the design and feel. This pair I bought for my wife. The only reason for the 4/5 stars is because I had to return the same pair I purchased for myself for a Medium.  I compared measurements to the size guide but I would suggest to size up if you are in any way concerned. It seems to me the measurements given and the max measurements and not those I would consider comfortable.
review.name: Nice light pad setup

name: VPD Air Sleeve

hasVariant.description: Buy the Reima Oikotie Softshell Pant - Boys' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Favorite hiking and playing pants for any fall/ spring/ cooler summer weather. Great in winter over base layer if we don’t want to do full snow suit. 

Great quality - we just spent an hour on a slab rock, sliding on the bum, no tears to fabric at all. 

Love the adjustable waist on my tall and slender kid.
review.name: Favorite cool weather pants.

review.reviewBody:
Warmer than I thought - or at least my kids have been wearing these in -15C weather with a warm pair of long johns without complaint. Great mobility and easy to put on, very durable. Love the visibility. A great product for shoulder season and even mild winter weather.
5 fits my 6 year old daughter (who is on the short size) very well and 9 fits my 9 year old perfects (she is an average height for her age) and they both have very different body types
review.name: great outdoors pants

review.reviewBody: They run small. I bought the same size as what he uses. And they all are tight. Had to return it. Other
Preschooler says they are comfortable, warm and kept her dry playing in the melting snow. Big bonus that they came in a fun color!
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: The pants are comfortable and protect well against the wind and rain. I’m planning to order another pair for both my kids!
review.name: Great addition to winter wardrobe

review.reviewBody: I am from Norway, and in Norway the kids are outside all year around. And there is a lot of weather! Reima is considered one of the best quality clothes for children! It last, keeps them warm and their design is loved by the children. So happy to find them in the US!
review.name: Reima -quality for kids

name: Oikotie Softshell Pant - Boys'

hasVariant.name: Plus Saddle

hasVariant.name: Plus Saddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Selle SMP Plus Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I just got it last week and have been out twice on it climbing lots of hills and riding gravel roads in Vermont. I love this seat. It is very comfortable, and the climbing performance is noticeable.
review.name: This seat is sweet!

review.reviewBody: Your junk and the boys down there feeling pressure? Be nice to your junk and the boys. I have a wide set of sit bones and this seat feels like going from an un-saddled rhinoceros to riding a soft saddled unicorn. Cant really say much else. My junk and the boys also feel free of the usual saddle pressure.
review.name: Love your junk

review.reviewBody: Saddles are very personal, and I confess that I may just be lucky that my SMP Plus seems to be made especially for my pelvis' sit bones. But this seat was an epiphany for me, and it's all I've ridden for years on all of my bikes. I can bore comfortably through a headwind for 30 minutes seated in the drops, no matter how rough the road. When changing positions I glide over the seat with plenty of room for my boys. And the nose droop is a perfect perch for spinning on steep climbs. Yes, you will be mocked with puerile manhood jokes. Jokes, however, are a small price to pay for a saddle that you can sit on forever with out pain. One warning; if you buy this saddle, you'll never go back.
review.name: Ignore the Haters

review.reviewBody: I had been riding a Specialized Power Saddle for the past few years without issue. With the pandemic I no longer taught spinning classes and set my road bike up on a Wahoo Kickr for indoor riding. I began to get chaffing which lead to saddle sores on my upper hamstring region. After researching saddles I took a leap of faith and purchased the SMP Plus as there were no demo?s available. After installing and adjusting I really like it! No more chafing and very comfortable...I now have it on both my bikes. On my outdoor bike I have it mounted to a Specialized Cobble Gobbler suspension seat post and am very comfortable even with extended rides...really saved me!!!
review.name: Sella SMP Plus

name: Plus Saddle

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Exactly what I looking for in the adaptive goggle lenses. Works great is sun and shade.. Interlocks perfectly with my Smith Ski Helmet.
review.name: Great Goggles.

review.reviewBody: They don’t fit well on my face both regular and Asian fit. My breath fogs up the lenses even though it’s just for a second is annoying but if it rains or snow melts it sucks to the inside cup part of the lens’s base base. I can’t even find anyone to buy them off me to I can get new ones it’s past the return date.
review.name: Ehh, at best

review.reviewBody: Haven’t owned them a year before the sticky helmet strip failed and is getting all over everything. This failure is unacceptable. Do not buy these.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody: Purchased on-sale. Excellent goggle, and it fits the Smith helmet I just bought
review.name: Quality goggle

review.reviewBody: I have used my goggles for less that 20 days of skiing and I have had two lenses lose the seal between the two layers of plastic.  They fogged between the two layers so they are unusable.
review.name: Lens lost seal, twice

review.reviewBody: Good lenses for a variety of skiing conditions, fit nicely on face with helmet- but the sticky on the goggle strap completely decomposed and left residue and sticky gunk all over my helmet. I didn’t notice till after my first day wearing them. Big bummer- hopefully it’s just a manufacturing mistake/fluke
review.name: Good lense, sticky falls apart

review.reviewBody: I bought this product twice and the silicone on the strap has not been cured properly. I would return them again, but I’m tired of paying for shipping fees. Other than quality control the lens is great.
review.name: Bad Silicone

review.reviewBody: After only one use and proper storage the new goggles I got within a year ( 10 months) is already breaking down. The strap adhesive is sticky and coming off destroying many pieces of my gear. Please be aware before you purchase this model.
review.name: Sticky Strap within a year

review.reviewBody: I love these goggles and I love the colab with north face on this specific pair. The view is great and they fit amazing with the maze helmet. Would recommend to anyone looking for a nice pair of goggles going into the season.
review.name: 10/10 would recommend

review.reviewBody: Love these new Smith Proxy googles. Nice wide field of view. Works well with ski helmet. Great contrast with Chromapop and with Photochromic these are great for the entire day. Highly recommended!
review.name: Proxy googles

name: Proxy Goggles

review.reviewBody: Great chair. Compact and easy to store. Even comes with its own bag. I like the bit of tillt back it has as well.
review.name: Dometic builds quality

review.reviewBody: I was comparing this and the yeti camp chair. I’m a bigger guy, so needed something sturdy. I went with this one because of cost, but mostly weight. The yeti chair is HEAVY. I agree with a few other reviews, this one leans back a little too much, and also has no cup holders. That’s almost a necessity with our electronics today.
review.name: Eh, ok.
comment:
Hi,
 
Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry for your experience. We always strive to satisfy our customers. If you have any further questions, we would be happy to help you. Please contact us via the following link : https://www.dometic.com/en-gb/support--service
 
Kind regards, 
Eszter
Dometic Sales Support

review.reviewBody:
The chair is comfortable, well made and easy to carry. The materials are excellent. The only problem is that it leans far too much back, causing you to leans forward a lot if you're trying to eat or have a conversation with someone. I purchased this so I could cook on my low table and my back and neck started hurting the next day. Not only is the backrest at close to a 45 degree angle, but so is the seat! 

The ideal customer would be sitting by themselves, enjoying the view (without a drink), and stretching their legs out. If you need to talk to someone, have a table in front of you, enjoy a drink while sitting, or cook then this is not for you.
review.name: What a missed opportunity
comment:
Hello, 
Thank you for reaching out.
We are really happy to hear your good experiences. We always strive to satisfy our customers, so we forwarded your feedback to our development team. 
We hope you will have a lot of adventures with our product. 
Kind regards,
Fanny
Dometic Sales Support

review.reviewBody: These were packaged well and arrived in perfect condition.  I bought four to put in my camping trainer along with the folding table and storage bag. The chairs are not suitable to sit in at the table. They are designed with a recline that is not adjustable. They fold easily and are very well put together.  Just were not comfortable.  I have asked to return them.
review.name: Great chairs, just not comfortable for me.
comment:
Hi, 

Thank you for your feedback. We always strive to satisfy our customers.
We forwarded your feedback to our development team to continue developing the product.

We hope you will have several good adventures with our product.

Kind regards, 
Fanny
Dometic Sales Support

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable chair. Perfect for camping and festivals. Packs and carries very easily into the bag.
review.name: Very Comfortable Chair

review.reviewBody:
Positive:

Comfortable 
Durable
Storage Bag
Stain Resistant 
Easy Clean

Cons:
Price
No Cup or Phone Storages 
Compact but doesnt store as well as frontrunner chairs
review.name: Dometic Go Camp Chair

review.reviewBody: I’ve used these for tailgating and I think they are every bit as good as the yeti chairs but for half the price.
review.name: Best folding chair for the money

review.reviewBody:
I ordered two Dometic camp chairs from Backcountry. The first was new and in new packaging. The second appeared to be previously used as it had wear spots in the fabric and even had a small hole in the material. The carrying case had black marks as it had also been used. It did not come with the original labels. I am disappointed as I am not sure if I received a previously returned item. It should have been advertised as used not new.

I tried to call your customer service help line, but my call was directed to a call center out of the country. Your gear head was not that helpful. 

As far as the quality of the chairs, the aluminum frames seem well constructed. However,  the “burley, heavy duty 600D fabric” does not seem like it will last the length of the 3 year warranty. I cannot recommend these chairs and they are not worth the money. 

Honestly, I think I am more disappointed with the Backcountry service than the product.
review.name: Not grea

review.reviewBody: I have used my chair almost every day for the last six months exploring Central America. I am 6"5 and 250 lbs and have a history of breaking chairs. The Go chair is comfortable, well made and very, very strong.
review.name: Excellent Camping Chair

review.reviewBody: I wish I would have paid attention to the name of the color rather than looking at the photos. Ash fully looks like a beige rather than a light grey which is what the chair really is. I was disappointed to see the color difference when I opened the package. Other than that the chair is very comfortable and easy to use.
review.name: Chair is comfortable but color is misrepresented

name: CMP-C1 Compact Camp Chair

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As a Girl Scout leader, these came just in time for our annual weekend d long Camporee! The color is great, they work as they should, and cleaned up nicely. They tucked away in my camping dish set perfectly though I do wish there was a ring or carabiner to keep them together. The size was great for my hands and my daughter’s hands (she’s 8). She asked for her own set once she used mine!
review.name: Sturdy, portable, easy to clean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Utensils are good for camping, but can be annoying if you have bigger hands. Did slightly stain with tomato juices, but otherwise would recommend for other foods.
review.name: Can stain

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The easiest cutlery to take to and from work each day. Easily identifiable as mine, easy to clean and easy to store. Throw it in your lunch bag and off you go!
review.name: Cute and compact.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like these utensils. They snap together so you don't lose them. They are lightweight and easy to hold and have a nice grip on them. I used them for a few different meals to see how easy they were to use and wash, and they passed all of those tests, including the greasy and the spaghetti sauce ones without leaving stains behind. They wash well with hand washing and in the dishwasher. The knife probably wouldn't cut foods like a tough steak, but it likely would cut most of the other foods. I used it to cut a burrito into bite-sized pieces, cut an omelet, cut a baked potato, spread butter and jam, etc and worked just fine.
review.name: Nice little set for camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The three piece Passage Cutlery Set in Teal is perfect for camping, picnics, & any outdoor food fun! Easy to clean, durable, & the knife cuts well, too. Loves it!!
review.name: Will last a very long time!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] i love the color and the material is great. i’m sure the durability will be great. portable, versatile, and easy to use and also easy to clean. great for the environment!
review.name: lovely

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was worried they would be flimsy but they are pretty heavy duty. I like that there are holes at the ends to throw on a caribeaner and go. The knife works pretty well too. Overall pretty awesome
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I don’t do much camping but this set is going to be great for my lunch box. Very durable. The pieces snap together at the handle to keep everything together. Good quality!!
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very durable and real good quality easy clean up and Very safe for the kids to use also fits storage size for convenience I'm pretty Satisfied with them
review.name: Very durable

name: Passage Cutlery Set
