description: Buy the SRAM GX Eagle 12-Speed Rear Derailleur online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GX Eagle 12-Speed Rear Derailleur
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM GX Eagle 12-Speed Rear Derailleur online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this to change my DeVinci Deore bike to grip shift. Love it!
review.name: GX Eagle

review.reviewBody: The GX 12 speed derailleur is the workhorse of the SRAM lineup. It offers great shifting performance, at an affordable price. The NX and SX derailleurs leave some to be desired in quality and performance. The X01 derailleur is lighter, but much more expensive. I recommend pairing a GX derailleur, and an X01 shifter. This is the best value for performance.
review.name: The best value SRAM derailleur

review.reviewBody: Had to buy a new derailleur to replace my old one, which had been bent after a few months of use. Almost immediately after I put the new one on, it bent, without crashing or anything. Definitely won?t be getting SRAM on my next bike. Sad to have wasted hundreds of dollars on new derailleurs, and that I have to continue doing so.
review.name: Awful derailleur
comment: use the warranty. Sram is excellent!

name: GX Eagle 12-Speed Rear Derailleur

description: Buy the GoPro Protective Sleeve for HERO online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Protective Sleeve for HERO
hasVariant.description: Buy the GoPro Protective Sleeve for HERO online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is too small for the Hero 13. I don’t know which one, but it’s definitely not the 13
review.name: Too small for Hero 13

review.reviewBody: Case seems ok at first, but you’ll see it’s tough to put on & when u finally do, you can’t open the door for the charger port. They say easy access to USB port, but not at all. You need to remove the entire case just to charge it. Soon the case will be stretched & worn from the amount of times you’d have to take it on & off
review.name: False advertising

review.reviewBody: The case is protective but the hole in the side isn't big enough to gain access to the charging port or the SD slot so you have to take the rubber cover off every time you charge it or want to take out the SD card. If you have the GoPro hero attached to an accessory you have to take it apart, take the rubber cover off then get access to the door to flip door to charge it. Really not very well thought out. So time consuming. All they had to do was make that hole big enough to get access to the flip door. Waste of money and time.
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody: This is a useless product which does not fit the camera.
review.name: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT

review.reviewBody: This is designed to keep it protected which I understand but it's a nightmare when trying to charge the GoPro or take out the SD card. You have to take the rubber cover off completely as the gap in the side is pointless as you cant open the protective door to the SD car. With this GoPro also having a fixed base connector you also have to unscrew it from whatever its attached to every time you want to charge it because you have to take the protective cover completely off. It also recommends the GoPro is charged often but with this stupid embarrassing design it's such a pain to keep taking it on and off. No thought has been put into this at all. Id expect much better from GoPro. Even the guy at the store was embarrassed to show it to me.
review.name: Terrible

review.reviewBody: Be careful this will not fit many of the Hero cameras (for example Hero 13) It only fits the smaller format cameras!
review.name: Does not fit all Hero cameras!

review.reviewBody: The description of this product is extremely misleading. It indicates it’s for the HERO. There are multiple models of the HERO GoPro. I just got the latest GoPro. The GoPro HERO 13. This does not fit that model despite the answer provided when someone asked on this page if it fits the 13. The answer provided by GoPro is that it fits the “new” HERO. IT DOES NOT. I wasted my money. It would cost me more money send it back to you because you charge to ship returns. It is absurd. I am stuck with a case that does not fit my new camera. Your description of this product is terrible. I don’t care how much market GoPro has. It is ridiculous. How much they nickel and dying you for every little accessory that should be included with the product. How do you not include any kind of protective case, a lanyard (it’s a piece of string!!), and a LENS COVER??? The next time I am looking to buy a camera like this, I will not be buying a GoPro..
review.name: This is not for the “new” HERO

name: Protective Sleeve for HERO

description: Buy the Shimano CS-M5100 Cassette online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CS-M5100 Cassette
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano CS-M5100 Cassette online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: CS-M5100 Cassette
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano CS-M5100 Cassette online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is great. I didn’t know cassettes came this big. It looks like a comically large hubcap back there but it works like it came new from the bike store. I did a 26er conversion….1999 Litespeed Ocoee HT, to a 1x (44 narrow wide/11-51 cassette) with…. Deore 11 speed rd-5100,  SRAM NX 11 spd grip shifter, old RaceFace turbine cranks(4 arm), ISIS - 73mm/113mm spindle w spacer (2.5 or 3mm) - shell is 68mm and kmc 11spd chain. I haven’t dropped a chain yet since my first shake down ride since spindle is perfectly centered. I still need to fine tune the shifting but the weight loss and loss of FD complexity really makes this one of the best upgrades/mods I’ve ever done and I’ve been cycling since 1990s. Great for hilly areas like my area.

Competitive Cyclist should have most of the parts you need at the best prices! Thanks Competitive Cyclist!
review.name: Great cassette!

review.reviewBody:
I went through 2 Sunrace 11x50 cassettes in 4 years  and was looking for a better option   Until Shimano came out with this cassette the best they had was a 11x46 with a huge jump to the 46   This new 11x51 works great with my 1x XT 8000 drivetrain 
Just needed a tweak of the B screw   Shifts are flawless and much better then the Sunrace 
Very happy
review.name: Great addition

review.reviewBody: The 11/51 provides a wide gear choice.  Makes the knees happy. Shifts are crisp and precise.   You should run a steel freehub, as the cassettes splines will gouge a aluminum freehub, and ruin it. With steel freehub, no problem. The cassette holds up extremely well in all conditions. I run it on a Pivot Mach 429 trail, 2x11 drivetrain. Riding trails from Michigan to Colorado to Arizona. I have worn out 2 cassettes in 3 years, due to rocks in Utah and Arizona.
review.name: 11/51 cassette happy

description: Buy the Eureka! Jade Canyon 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Jade Canyon 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Jade Canyon 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ability to stand in the entire tent space, simplicity of set up and Eureka's reputation, make it a great family tent.

Finally had to replace our older tent and used this new purchase the first time in the ADK in late August.  Love the lightness and quick set up.   Stayed dry in its first storm.  Only con is no where to put wallets keys phone except on the ground, wish it had some off ground pockets.
review.name: Excellent replacement of 20 year old Eureka

review.reviewBody: Great tent. Easy enough setup. Feels very roomy. Multiple people can easily stand up and get dressed in this tent at the same time. The square footprint makes it ideal for cots or an air mattress.
review.name: Comfortable car camping tent

review.reviewBody:
This is a fantastic tent. The price is right, it held up really well to some light hail and some really strong gusts in my camping trip. Setup is really easy and the height is fantastic to use.

My only complaints are small ones that I would not necessarily expect at this price point. I wish there were more pockets in the tent for storage, and the little ones in the corners were touching a part of the tent where water would seep through if you touched it so things in those pockets needed to be water proof or you could not use them. 

Otherwise, for the money this tent can't be beat!
review.name: It does what it does well

review.reviewBody: After considerable research and talking to many tent owners, I bought the Jade Canyon X4 tent for myself and my two sons to use for camping trips. Living in south Texas, I was especially concerned with ventilation issues. After having used the tent in the hot Texas summer, I can say without a doubt that this tent exceeded our expectations. Also, it is easy to set up and take down. I have also used this tent in a rain storm and we stayed dry and experienced no issues with water leaks. The text is very spacious and the best part is that you can stand up inside. I highly recommend the Jade Canyon X4 to anyone think about purchasing a tent for family camping.
review.name: Jade Canyon X4 Tent Exceeded Expectations

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent as a replacement/upgrade to my Eureka Sunrise 9 that I have been using for Boy Scout Summer camp for many years.  With the more vertical sides, his tent has greater volume, less curves, and greater height compared to the Sunrise.  The tent is more complicated than the Sunrise with the additional poles, but that is what gives it the volume.  As such, in potentially windy situations, I will use the additional ropes to help secure the tent down.  Was a little surprised to see the windows are held up by little toggles in lieu of a zipper, but the design appears to be water tight, and should be a lot quieter than zippers.  Went with the Jade Canyon over the Copper Canyon because of the thicker material and higher quality poles, since I plan on using this tent for many years of summer camp.  I will still use a plastic ground cloth underneath, and the fitted footprint inside, to help take care of the floor and get many years of use out of this tent.  This is my 4th Eureka tent, as I still use my Eureka Backpacking tent I purchased 30+ years ago.
review.name: Summer Camp Tent

review.reviewBody: This has tall walls, lots of vented windows so it is perfect for summer and autumn in southern California and its mountains. One person can set it up, if folds small and lightweight for car camping! We have used it three times already and it holds up wonderfully. I am a newbie camper, but my seasoned camper friends all love it also.
review.name: So Roomy!

review.reviewBody: Love the height, easy to pitch. Directions could be a little better.
review.name: Great Standing Height Tent!

review.reviewBody: We extensively researched tents when looking for a bigger version than our old “”4 person”” Coleman Flatwoods. We wanted a tent that we could not only stand up in, but was quality. We had never heard of Eureka tents and were skeptical. Im SO glad we got this tent. It was our home on a two week car camping trip and was put up, taken down, and moved almost every day. It is ridiculously easy to put up & down. Im talking one person, two minutes tops. The poles are THICK, sturdy, and a beautiful bright color. Really quality design and SO spacious. The flap windows concerned me originally but they work great in use. Love customizing the open window shape with the various window “latches”. We had rain over a few days and the tent stayed dry. I was impressed. My onnnly complaint is that the floor is a little thinner than my old coleman, however it may be nicer material. Overall, we love our Jade Canyon and are extremely pleased with our choice!
review.name: Car camping luxury!

review.reviewBody: I haven't gone camping in the tent yet.  I just set it up in my backyard.  It set up relatively easy and looks like it will be great.  I think I just regret not having gotten the 6 person size.
review.name: Looks Good!

name: Jade Canyon 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: This shoe gives you a ton of ground feel, which I love. I wear barefoot shoes and usually run in mid-cushion trail shoes, like the Saucony Peregrine or Topo Mtn Racer. This shoe is super light too, which feels awesome. The toe box is nice and roomy and the mid and heel fit is loose but not sloppy. My two gripes are the gusseted tongue and the lugs. The tongue is floppy and attached to the sole with two big elastic bands. For some reason I find it really hard to put the shoes on without wrinkling up my socks. It also feels a little weird once I do have my sock straightened out, like my mid-foot is being squeezed in a weird way. The lugs aren't great in the mud. They aren't very deep, and they're flat. I don't know if I would buy these again. I would probably just buy another pair of Sauconys for $70 less. One other thing, I'm usually an 11.5, with this shoe I went with an 11. They run about a half size large.
review.name: Almost the perfect shoe

review.reviewBody: These shoes are about 40 bucks more than I think they should be, given similar competition, but they are very good and still my go-to choice for big miles over super technical terrain. I live in Tucson and the trails in the Santa Catalina mountains are very rocky, very technical, and have tons of vertical. Half the time there is more of a scramble than a run. The rocks are either very smooth and slick from water or razor sharp and most other shoes I have aren't grippy enough and/or they are durable enough to handle the abuse. The lower lug depth works really well for these drier rocky technical trails, the upper doesn't tear or blow out anywhere from wear or from rocks or cactus. The laces always stay tied but are a few inches too long, IMO. The foam is cushy enough for 12 hour runs while also giving good enough protection from rocks and insane trail feel. I have to size down 1/2 a size from normal, no pun intended, because they run long. They are also super light and dry quickly when they get wet given there is no insole. They aren't fancy, and are expensive, but they are the one shoe that always works and doesn't fall apart.
review.name: Expensive but bombproof

review.reviewBody: Really thrilled with all these boutique shoes coming out (Nnormal, Norda, etc) lately and that we are getting away from the mass produced 100's of models of the same shoe that all underperform and consider the environment.  Fully transparency - these shoes were purchased on sale, which was a big help.  First impressions were that the shoe feels very minimalistic and the fact that Killian wins 100 milers in these tells me that he could win barefoot, however the cushion is wild because the rebound is there, the durability is there and the protection is somehow there too while offering the most ground feel i have experienced outside of something i would never actually run a race in.  Really happy with these shoes, upper is next level, fits like a glove and i usually opt for wider type toe box shoes.  I have probably 140+ miles on these, handled a fairly grueling trail race and many training runs inbetween and somehow this shoe is a top pick for every sort of run, be it a race, recovery run, hike or long run it can do it all.  Only complaint is that i feel like this shoe would improve alot with only a drop more stack, that and the lack of insole takes a little getting used to and caused some blisters at first but other than that its awesome.  Also thank you to Backcountry for hooking it up after the first pair that was delivered got robbed by some porch pirates.  Order a half size down.
review.name: Best or 2nd best trail shoes available

review.reviewBody: My new favorite running shoe. Its not super cushioned, but bouncy and fun to run in. Its also very lightweight. So far, more durable than any other shoe I have had. It's a little expensive, but its basically saving you 2 or 3 shoes.  Runs about 1/2 size big.
review.name: Fun to run in, durable, new favorite

name: Kjerag Shoe

review.reviewBody: I am absolutely thrilled with my purchase! I searched for weeks for the perfect coat. I knew what I wanted, but could not find the exact coat that checked off all the boxes. This one is beyond what I had imagined. The material is beautiful, soft, high quality cotton! It's durable, yet very nice looking. It's the perfect length  for me at 5'9", I'm 150lbs and ordered a med. Fits like it was made for me. It doesn't bunch up anywhere and I don't sit on it when I sit down. It doesn't look boxy, has a nice natural shape and lays/hangs well. It's lightweight, but feels like an expensive down blanket. The pockets are perfect size and warm. I love the fact it's all cotton and down without feathers to eventually poke thru. It's extremely warm . The color is absolutely gorgeous, the parka looks way better in person.
review.name: Best Purchase!!

name: Cotton Down Parka - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Chore Farm Leather Chelsea Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots are well-suited for walking the dog in wet fall weather, and the waterproofing performs admirably. To enhance their longevity, I applied two coats of Nikwax for leather after my initial wear, as I noticed the factory waterproofing may not hold up over time. One area for improvement would be the fit; they feel a bit narrow for my feet. If they could be slightly wider, they would undoubtedly be ideal for longer walks with my dog and shorter semi-urban hikes. Overall, I appreciate the quality and functionality of these boots!
review.name: Good boot but a little narrow

review.itemreviewed: Chore Farm Leather Chelsea Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Purchased these boots to wear while walking the dog in cold weather.  They are good looking boot/shoes, keep my feet warm and so far dry, Just dissatisfied with the depth of the sole treads and the rubber composition.  In about an inch of snow and a slight grassy(mown) slope, traction is poor, up and down the slope.
review.name: Decent Boots

name: Chore Farm Leather Chelsea Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I love love love these gloves.  I had the normal 5 finger for about 10 years, and now that I'm old-ish my hands just don't stay as warm as they used to.  I ended up buying these because other Hestra 3 finger ones that I bought weren't as warm as my gloves in this model.  These 3 finger ones are amazing... and I'm hoping they make a mitt again because I'll buy those too.
My gloves are size 10, so I bought a size 10 and 11 in these and went with the 11.  Sizing up was the right choice.
review.name: Best gloves you can buy!

review.reviewBody: Initially, I was sold on the looks, read the reviews and those that said they were the best gloves they have ever had didn't lie. Several days skiing in 10 degree weather had me so pleased that I had spent a little extra money, as my fingers and hands were never even close to cold, even when I was stuck waiting for others for 30+ minutes not skiing I was beyond comfortable. I have been waiting for more reasons to wear them, but weather has not been in my favor.
review.name: Amazing Gloves, never cold

review.reviewBody: I found one side of these gloves along the side of the road. They were 4 sizes too big for me, however they felt great with the finger pockets inside the mitten. I searched for them online and found them at Backcountry. They offered a tempting sale price. I found them to be warm and flexible (allowing for much finger dexterity) I am very happy with this purchase.
review.name: Best glove!

review.reviewBody: I was first hesitant about this mit due the limited number of reviews I’ve found, but after finally trying them on, I can say with certainty it is the BEST I’ve ever owned. 5 finger insulation for each individual finger, water proof and durable. They feel as if you’re still wearing a five finger glove, but with the warmth and padding of a mit. The do run a tad bit smaller than hestras other gloves so I’d recommend sizing up one size. I have the hestra fall line gloves in a 10 so I ordered these in 11 and they fit perfectly. This will definitely be my last pair for a very long time.
review.name: BEST 3 finger mit I’ve owned so far!

name: Vertical Cut CZone 3-Finger Glove

review.reviewBody: They look great, but have absolutely no foot support, I had to put some store-bought insole support for the footbed, the footbed was not comfortable at all until I put the orthotic insole w/an arch in it. It's true to size, I wear a size 9 and size 9 comfortably fit my foot, I have slightly narrow foot and it felt snug in this boot, didn't feel like my feet were swimming in it like other medium width boots can feel like to a narrow width foot. But as you take a stride, it's not the most comfortable boot, they look comfortable but aren't. They look fashionable though. The chunky heel bothered me more than I thought it would, I normally buy no heel Merrell's and they didn't have any good snowboots this year so I opted for something as similar as I could get, except for the heel. I didn't think the Kamik's were nearly as comfortable as my old Merrell's, because the footbed of the Kamik Sienna 3 boot was lacking in comfort.  I take them off and my feet feel relieved when I put my slippers on like my feet weren't happy in the boots, so I can't really recommend this boot.
review.name: Just not comfortable

name: Sienna 3 Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: ADV SWAT Thermal Bib Knicker - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Seems specialized has decided to go the way of castelli sizing. I'm 5'9" and 130 lbs and a medium barely covers my knees. I originally got a small and returned them. The medium pair that I got next had clearly been returned so seems other folks are sending these back too. 
Why is there only a pocket on one leg? That one pocket is also really small (seems pretty stretchy though). I never used these but the whole floppy back pockets seem useless. Would recommend these and I'll not be looking at spesh clothing anytime soon.
review.name: Pockets too small and sizing way off

name: ADV SWAT Thermal Bib Knicker - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Nikwax Tent & Gear DUO-Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Five star product: I have had about 1000 nights in my tent. The waterproofing held up in wind, rain, and ice. On top of that, I live in Arizona, where UV degredation destroys nylon in a matter of days. My tent has been retreated every other year, and it is still tear resistant and strong. I bought Solarproof again because I trust the product.

Two star shipping. The bottles arrived wrapped in plastic, which was thoughtful. They had spilled during shipping and the plastic DID prevent the liquid from getting on the rest of my order. However, it was not a small spill. The Solarproof bottle is less than half full. I collected as much of the spilled liquid as I could into a spare bottle. I am not sure how mixed with the Solarwash it is now. Hopefully, mixing will not impact the effectiveness. I lost much more than I had hoped.
review.name: Great Product. Terrible Shipping.

name: Tent & Gear DUO-Pack
Tent & Gear DUO-Pack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydro Flask Serving Spoons online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love these spoons and their neutral colors. They will be perfect with my Hydro flask bowls at barbeques the summer!
review.name: Great serving spoons

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are some really good serving spoons and they can also withstand heat too. I have been using these since I have received them in the mail and these mare made from great quality material and they work great.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Bought these to add to our camping set. Love them!
review.name: Awesome set

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using both Hydroflask serving spoons for the past few months and they are really nice.  I love the colors, not just your traditional black.  They match my kitchen and my kitchen in my camper.  They clean up nicely too. Very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Great serving spoons

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These spoons are perfect and a nice neutral color. I am able to use it at home or when I go camping. It’s a perfect match for the bowl and I love to make salads and toss in the dressing with these. They are easy and lightweight I love them.
review.name: Great spoons

review.reviewBody: Perfect for the new bowls. Super durable and handy!
review.name: These are great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this product in exchange for an honest product review. Another great product from hydro flask. These are great spoons for using outdoors to serve food. They are very sturdy, easy to clean and easy to store.
review.name: Great spoons

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are really great spoons. They are made of good material. The hold up super good. They work great for at home or at a picnic. They are really easy to wash. Like the weight of them because they don't bend easy when string food.
review.name: Great spoons

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As the chef of the family I'm always looking for items that make cooking a lot easier.  You always need a good serving spoon.  I don't really care for wooden spoons (trauma from my grandmother plus they are hard to clean) & for some reason I don't care for metal spoons.  I was looking for a good plastic type spoon & these seemed to appear from Heaven.

They are strong, I doubt they will break in the future.  They are the perfect size for serving & mixing.  What I love about them is I can put them in boiling water when I make spaghetti & I can stir my piping hot chili.  I simply LOVE these spoons & would highly recommend them to anyone who needs a good serving spoon
review.name: Great serving spoons

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These serving spoons are of perfect sizes and are made of good quality. They look nice with used with other hydroflask items. However, there isn't really anything special about these spoons. They are solid and good and complete the set... but in the end, they are serving spoons (dishwasher safe!)
review.name: Great quality

name: Serving Spoons

description: Buy the Gregory Targhee FastTrack 24L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Targhee FastTrack 24L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Targhee FastTrack 24L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Targhee FastTrack 24L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Targhee FastTrack 24L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This pack is fantastic, but misses some areas that other packs excel at. Most notably access to the main compartment via a large U zipper. There are also no straps to attach a snowboard vertically to the back of the pack with us a bummer.
review.name: Great Backcountry Backpack

review.reviewBody: Ruggedly built large capacity day pack.  I bought it because the padded hip belt is removable as is the frame.  Could use a zippered pocket inside the main compartment for small items and the main compartment zipper should extend the length of the pack, at least along one side, for access to stuff at the bottom.  Quibbles aside, this pack will get the job done no matter how much stuff (or water) you cram into it.  Rust color is dark rust, not orange.  Great sale price.
review.name: Maximum Flexibility and Durability

review.reviewBody:
It's a good pack with a couple minor complaints. The pocket design is different than other traditional touring packs and I'm not convinced it's in a good way. The shovel and probe are accessible through the main compartment zipper while the main pack compartment is separated by a Bungie top closure. This works okay except the shovel/probe naturally press against the main compartment opening making it harder to access pack contents. The other issues is that as the pack fills up, the shovel\probe sit more upright, pushing the exterior of the pack out and away and creating a negative space outside the main compartment. This becomes a space that isn't easy to fill with the top of the shovel\probe sticking up. Although I've found it's kinda nice to just toss a layer of two or gloves in and put of this space and not need to throw them back in the main compartment. Another minor issue is if the pack is full and the shovel\probe facing up, the lid tops main pocket gets pretty crushed from the shovel\probe. Hard to keep goggles in there and I'm worried my sunglasses or similar items might break. Another little issue is the deployable helmet cover pulls down from the top and I've noticed a couple times it beginning to spread apart the main compartment zippers. It also forces the mini pocket it comes from to stay open so no valuables can go in there although I use it for snacks, ski straps, hand warmers, etc... 

Beyond that it's a really solid pack that has everything else you'd want from a touring pack. Lightweight, two ice axe capacity, hipbelt pocket and gear loop, daisy chains which I added some Bungie for crampons (but it's mostly been used for beer cans haha). The color scheme is great and I really like it. The fast track feature is cool and I've used it a couple times but ya gotta really ask yourself how often you'll use it. I've had trouble getting the skis fully crosswise to balance the load. It normally stays on the right side and any extended booting that sucks. I gotta check out their videos again to make sure I'm doing it right.
review.name: Solid backpack with a couple issues

review.reviewBody: Ski sling has a poor design, zippers on the top of the backpack could be designed better overall terrible backpack
review.name: Trash

name: Targhee FastTrack 24L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
These are great every day boots. They are comfortable to walking around and standing for long periods of time. The toe box is large enough to not feel any pinching at the toes. Great multipurpose boot!

Not sure if there is anything I would recommend improving for these. Definitely pleased with this purchase! Highly recommend a pair or two of these.
review.name: High quality comfort

review.reviewBody: Love the boot and it looks great but the leather in the heal and the rubber sole are all coming apart.  Only been wearing them for a couple weeks.  If they could fix this issue it would easily be 4 or 5 stars
review.name: Great boot but sole quality is lacking
comment: Hi Joey, we are sorry that these boots did not stack up and we appreciate this feedback. At Ariat we strive to deliver quality craftsmanship in all our for further assistance in this matter.

review.reviewBody: Love these for dressing up. They work great for my pants that aren’t made for my regular cowboy boots. Waterproof and work great as far as non slip in rain. Super comfortable also as I usually end up wearing these to shows etc and on my feet 8+ hours on concrete and don’t have issues with foot pain.
review.name: Great “fancy” boot

review.reviewBody: Got a pair of these for a trip to the European Christmas markets. When I first wore them a few day before they scraped the back of my ankle. It was only after googling that I came across information on Reddit and Ariat’s own website that tells you that you must break in the boot before wearing. I did not see this on the product page. (May have missed it). Once I spent 30 min doing that, they performed flawlessly even in the rain. Would highly recommend!
review.name: MUST be broken in BEFORE wearing!

review.reviewBody: Both the toes have started to separate from the soles.
review.name: After 2-1/2 years of medium use

review.reviewBody: I had such high hopes for these boots. They felt amazing when I first tried them on so I took a risk and wore them for my first 4 day trip. They are so heavy and clunky. Too big in heal area and allows for slip and pulls my socks down while being too tight across the mid foot/toe area. My legs are already tired after one day. They have great cushion and I love that they don’t set off the metal detector but unfortunately these were not worth the investment. The search for a great waterproof boot continues.
review.name: Had high hopes
comment: We’re sorry to hear we didn’t stack up! We’d really appreciate a chance to connect with you in a more meaningful way on how we can improve. Please email info@ariat.com with additional details on your experience so that we can better assist you.

review.reviewBody: Just as described. Good fit, seem like they’ll last for years.
review.name: Get em!

review.reviewBody: Great Boot! Comfortable and stylish! On my second pair!
review.name: Love em!

review.reviewBody: I love these boots. They are comfortable and stylish.
review.name: Happy Feet

review.reviewBody: What can I say!! These boots are amazing!! So comfortable and surprisingly warm!! I can't recommend them enough!!!!
review.name: Great boots

name: Wexford Waterproof Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love that these concert. Perfect for weather that changes really quick.
review.name: Just do it, Buy It!

review.reviewBody: I love this pants, it's the second pair I buy because are super comfy and practical for long trekkings with different temperatures due to the convertible capacity.
review.name: Great pants which I totally recommend!

review.reviewBody: Bought a pair of Paramount Convertible Pants 6 years ago and they were and still are wonderful. Had a need for a second pair and North Face indicated that these were the "updated" version. The pants fit and will work for an urban hip-hop hiker well. They were NOT made for the mountains. Belt won't stay cinched. Legs snag on every little thing. Don't even try to take of the lower leg part if your boots are muddy. You won't be able to. The old style had a zippered sleeve that opened up making this SO easy. North Face, appears to have decided that they'd rather concentrate on the hip-hop crowd and have mostly abandoned the Outdoors Adventurer crowd.
review.name: Not a chance. May abandon North Face forever.

review.reviewBody: Great pants, dry quickly but are a slim fit pant, they are not loose fit.
review.name: Great Pair of Hiking Pants

review.reviewBody: The material is tough and stretchy, but the moderate taper is too much. The picture used online are not representative how much taper there actually is. Wish there was an option for picking fit.
review.name: Very Euro style...not my thing.

review.reviewBody: Comfy, light and trendy. I got some olive oil on them the first day!!! Stained for life. Spots. I dunno if the material is strange from it being plastic? But they stained the first day and won't come clean :(
review.name: Amazing product. Stained easily, instantly

review.reviewBody: Perfect hiking pant, lightweight and breathable, yet built well and to last. Converting them is a breeze. Definitely getting more pairs.
review.name: Perfect Hiking Pant.

review.reviewBody: We ordered a men's size large. The pants were tagged as such but they were more of a women's size large. Sent them back and still waiting on refund.
review.name: I would not buy this product!

review.reviewBody:
Came with the button pulled through on one side.
Unusable.
review.name: Broken Button

review.reviewBody: Used this on over a dozen trips now and here are my overall thoughts: Overall fit -- 5 stars Fabric & construction -- 5 stars Built in belt -- 0 stars The belt is held in place by the friction the fabric being doubled over a metal buckle. It is constantly coming loose and needing to get re-tightened. Not easy to do when it is under the waist of my backpack. If I can find an after market replacement belt narrow enough to fit these pants, they will be one of my favorite pair. Until then, they are the pair that I grab when everything else is dirty.
review.name: Mixed feelings

name: Paramount Pro Convertible Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great addition to my new stove system. Worth having it just for coffee
review.name: Great add-on

review.reviewBody: Sweet little device that goes well with the base camp.  How water is less than 2 mins away whenever we need it for ramen, coffee or tea.
review.name: Best side kick

review.reviewBody: Should come with a plastic cover for burner/igniter
review.name: Nice but could stand improvement.

review.reviewBody: Great addition for the Genesis Base Camp system, especially for those coffee aficionados. Now, please understand you need to have a JetBoil pot/coffee press in order to use the Luna or purchase the additional cook top grate attachement in order to use the burner with an aftermarket water boiler.
review.name: Coffee cooker extraordinaire

review.reviewBody: The Luna Satellite Burn is a excellent addition to the Jetboil cook systems and make for greater cooking needs. Temperature control for simmering or boiling is a breeze and provides a stable plat form.
review.name: Third Eye for cooking.

review.reviewBody: I bought some months ago and was boiling water fit coffee. The plastic base melted. Horrible smell
review.name: It melted
comment: Thank you for taking the time to write your review. I am sorry to hear about your Luna. We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concern. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday.

review.reviewBody: Worked flawlessly and tied right into my Basecamp. Really completes the entire system.
review.name: Perfect addition to the Jetboil Basecamp

review.reviewBody: Just got back from the French river and used the Luna all weekend.  I have a Eureka Stove and the luna plugs right into it.  So instead of using the butane gas which is pricy I can just use the gas from my 5 pound gas tank.  We used the burner with a jet boil pot and made coffee in minutes with this stove.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Wish I had it sooner

review.reviewBody: Bought the Luna Satellite Burner to replace an older one that has been damaged of no fault of the construction. Love the base camp unit and the Luna burner. We motorcycle camp with a pull behind camper. The unit is compact, light weight and very efficient. We do extended trips and use the Genesis system 2 to 3 times per day. Purchased a 10 pound propane tank and use the Genesis system for all our cooking needs, from making lattes with eggs and hash browns in the morning to baking in our back pack oven. Great unit and highly recommend the entire system..
review.name: Genesis Base Camp Addition

review.reviewBody: Purchased the burner as a replacement for one that melted while heating an espresso pot for a friend.  Won't do that again!  This burner is light, quick and easy to use.  The valve is one of the best I have used and it provides plenty of range with excellent control over multiple turns. Want a simmer, you get a simmer.  None of the "just touch the valve" and it goes from full throttle to off that most burners experience.
review.name: Fast and easy

name: Luna Satellite Burner
Luna Satellite Burner

review.reviewBody: Much easier to install/remove than I originally thought. Have it on a 2024 F-150 and love it.
review.name: Perfect Bike Rack

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bike rack after careful consideration of all the options available.  While it is one of the pricier options you'll find, I am certain there are none that feel as sturdy when carrying bikes than this one.  Assembly takes two people to make everything easy. While the instructions could be a bit clearer, it went together with only a few bolts and nuts.  There is an included and integrated cable bike lock to secure your bikes to the rack when you park in those shadier parts of town.  The rack system also comes with a keyed hitch pin, making attachment to your vehicle simple and secure. 

One of the most unexpected features I do appreciate is the way the hitch can tighten down and compress within the receiver. This makes the rack feel extremely secure and removes any wobble from the rack.  Loading bikes is a breeze. Lift them onto the rack, lift the locking arm and loop the rear tire strap and tighten. Much easier than the older racks a used to have with all the straps and excess cords to deal with.  

The rack does tilt down and out of the way for easier access to the back of your SUV.  It drops fast, so be prepared that first time you pull the lever. I am considering getting the swing arm mount to move the rack totally out of the way, instead of reaching over the rack and bikes, but for now, this will have to do.  

There is a small tire adapter for the kid size bikes you may be traveling with, included in the system.  The rack will also accommodate fat tire bikes with ease.
review.name: The bike rack you need!

review.reviewBody:
Integrated Workstand: The rack features an integrated workstand, making it convenient for bike maintenance.
Easy Tilt Mechanism: You can easily tilt the rack to access your vehicle’s trunk without removing the bikes.
Hitch Cam Lock: The hitch cam lock ensures stability and prevents wobbling during transport.
Quality Construction: The powder-coated finish is durable, and the welds are well-executed.
Stable Storage: When stored vertically, the rack remains stable.
Considerations: It’s large and may be awkward to maneuver during storage.
Overall, the Kuat NV 2.0 is a reliable choice for transporting bikes, especially if you appreciate attention to detail and thoughtful featuresAd1. Happy riding! 🚴‍♂️🌟
review.name: The Kuat NV 2.0 is a top-tier 2bike rack

review.reviewBody:
I owned this rack for about 4 months on my Ford Maverick and was impressed by the build construction and ease of use. The anti-wobble mechanism that takes up slack in the hitch mount is near perfect and never came loose for me - the thing is rock steady when mounted. The fold-up mechanism, ratchet arms, and wheel straps all seemed really solid and didn't give me any trouble. 

The locking mechanism doesn't seem as well set up for longevity as the rest of the rack. This rack has two lock cables - one per bike tray - which store inside of the tray when not in use. This feature is awesome because it allows you to lock both bikes (think theft deterrent, not necessarily prevention) within 20-30 seconds. However, when the cable locks get dirty, as they will when locking around mountain bike wheels, they tend to slide back into the tray storage position roughly - the system is not very tolerant to debris. As well, the cavities where the cables slide into tend to collect some water. When I took the rack off my truck and tilted it on end, about a quarter cup of water dripped out of each tray. As a result, the ends of the locking cables were starting to rust from sitting in the water (and the dirt probably didn't help things either) by the time I went to sell the rack. I park outdoors and the rack was exposed to the elements all summer, so this may not be a problem for those with a garage.

The bike repair stand that is built into the end of the rack has some sizing issues. I was using it with a Specialized Stumpjumper EVO with Shimano XT clip-in pedals and this setup was too wide for the rack. The pedal hit the rack preventing the crank from turning freely. This is a bummer because turning the crank to adjust your drivetrain is of course half the point of mounting your bike to a repair stand. It's a great feature, it just needs to be adjusted outwards to accommodate modern mountain bikes.
review.name: Good rack, lock system could be improved

review.reviewBody: Although there are several great tacos on the market, the NV 2.0 is functional, simple and attractive. It’s sturdy, works well, and the company Kuat offers great product support.
review.name: Solid & Satisfied

review.reviewBody: I’ve been a Yakima guy for 10 years. I thought Kuat would be an upgrade based on price, but the way bikes lock in on Kuat are more finicky and the straps don’t have a synch ratchet. I have to stop because the bikes shake around and i go back and tweak and adjust to get them sesure. Seems like the rear wheel straps will break soon - they’re very weak. I wish I had my yakima back.
review.name: Flimsy wheel straps

review.reviewBody: Rack is rock solid? Looks great? Feels like it is welded to my vehicle.  No rattle at all. I installed a 2 inch hitch from ehitch to my 2021 Mazda CX 5 and to my surprise with the rack in the up position I can open the rear hatch without dropping the rack. Overjoyed with this. Added bonus.
review.name: More than perfect

review.reviewBody: I researched for months before I decided this was the most functional rack based on specifications and reviews.  I’m returning the favor with my review.  First and foremost, Backcountry’s shipping speed consistently impresses.  At a whopping 53 pounds, this rack is easily lifted using both upper extremities and proper body mechanics.  It’s sits a little higher than my previous Yakima, which I owned for 4 years before I started to notice rust that came from washing my bike while on the rack and not drying it.  That was on me.  Once loaded onto hitch, I really appreciate the knob mechanism used to secure rack to reduce excess movement.  The hitch pin included easily slides through right side opening and locks of left.  Unfold it by pulling a hefty lever that’s easily accessible, and assist by passively lowering until it sits horizontally.  Because the rack sits a little higher than my previous hitch, I have to raise my bike a bit more to load it, but, I’m also 5 feet short.  Front tire hook is solid, and rear tire cinch is a breeze.  I will say that my previous hitch had a loop to anchor down rear tire cinch to keep it out of the way while I loaded my bike.  It’s the only thing missing on this rack to give it a perfect rating.  It also comes with magnetic tie downs that require a key, which comes in handy while making a quick pit stop and fear your bike may get snatched.  I almost forgot to mention I purchased it at a discounted total of 735.23.  I selected the black option because I felt the grey/orange (also very nice) may be more conspicuous.  Overall, very, very pleased with my solid decision.
review.name: Very, very pleased with my solid choice.

review.reviewBody:
My family has different biking preferences and it only seems these preferences are going to grow. We at the moment have a full suspension mountain bike, kids bike, gravel bike, and will probably grow to fat tire bikes, and anywhere in between. We had a hard time finding a rack that could do it all without rubbing frames. Well, we found it here.

I like the small features, the fact that the rack doesn't shift and rock around, the extra arm to work on bikes on the road, which we have had to use already. This rack is heavy with just the 2, and we will soon add the extension, so getting this on and off the car will be a bit difficult, I figure that is a small issue. The loading and unloading of bikes is so easy, I can load my bike go pick up a friend and go wherever we want without adding much time.

Well worth the cost!
review.name: Great rack for different bike types

review.reviewBody: Definitely over engineered meaning it's going to last a lifetime. It also comes with 2 adapters to fit smaller / kids bikes (ie, 20" wheel size) which is a huge plus if you've got kids wanting to ride. As people have said before, you get what you pay for with this product. If you're planning on using this on a Jeep Wrangler or an truck plan on getting the Pivot extension.
review.name: Functions and looks great!

name: NV 2.0 Bike Hitch Rack

My dog pulled a little to my right and the right footed flip flop just completely came apart where the toe thong connected to the sole. Threw them away after just two times wearing. What a waste of money!

review.reviewBody: I had ordered these same flips about a year ago. They are perfect and I love them. Although this pair says they are the same size, they are too long. I am keeping them to wear around the house.

review.reviewBody: Perfect flip flops when you’ve got 6 Screws and a plate in your ankle
review.name: HOKA Ora Recovery Flip Flop

review.reviewBody: I have sore feet when I work all day. After work you will always find me with my Ora's on
review.name: Without a doubt, the most comfortable flip I have ever put o

review.reviewBody: These sandals are comfortable and supportive. I wear a 12.5 and I purchased size 13. They're perfect.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: My husband developed a very painful condition known as Plantar Fasciitis. We googled it and learned one cause can be poor shoes. His flip-flops , just a CosCo special, were the culprit, they provided no support. I ordered these recovery sandals and they were good looking enough so he is willing to wear them. They provide much-needed support particularly to his heel. They have really helped
review.name: Stylish support

review.reviewBody: Sole was too wide, felt like a boat, and real slimey feel. Strap was of inferior quality (unusual for Hola) and didn't feel substantial at all.
review.name: Returned flip flops

review.reviewBody: Using these slippers helped my foot heal, I love these slippers.
review.name: Plantar Fasciitis

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, lots of pockets and room for a weeks worth of clothing + shoes etc!  Also, several sizes to choose from!!  My friends are always looking for products that simplify their life just like me! So this backpack happens to be one of the perfect items for them as it comes in different sizes and shapes for whatever their needs happen to be!
review.name: An Amazing Travel Backpack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received the Speed Lite 28 SL for Women to try.  It is lightweight and fits well and stays in place with waist and shoulder straps. I did some hiking this month while on vacation and liked that it was easy to use.  I does have pockets for your phone and wallet.
review.name: Lightweight Backpack for Women

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This hiking bag is spacious inside and easy to fit a jacket in. The design makes it convenient to access all the different compartment. The straps and the back support are comfortable even for a long hike. I also like there are hidden pockets with zipper on top part of the bag. Materials are super light and waterproof. Also, great for travel use.
review.name: Great for hiking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I recently received the Dueter Speed Lite 28 SL Wandern Hiking Randonnee Backpack. It’s very lightweight and has plenty of pockets and storage space. It is a snug fit and stays in position with the equipped waist belt and shoulder straps
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this for myself to have on my camping trip. It’s really light which made it easier for me to use. I was able to get to my campsite without having to stop. I could take this with me on every trip. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. You wouldn’t be disappointed.
review.name: Great product

name: Speed Lite SL 28L Backpack - Women's

description: Buy the Ooni Koda 12in Gas Powered Pizza Oven online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Koda 12in Gas Powered Pizza Oven
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ooni Koda 12in Gas Powered Pizza Oven online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered the oven for me as gift from family. Made a dough ahead of time. 1 son and I made 5 pizzas on Christmas night and all were very happy with them. Need to work on dough stretching and turning.
review.name: Christmas Ooni!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First pizza - burnt! After seeing how HOT this oven is…I adjusted and the second was perfect!
review.name: A hit!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it
review.name: Best portable pizza oven

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome results for a novice pizza maker! Very impressed.
review.name: Awesome results for a novice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm getting used to rotating the pizza quick enough to prevent burning
review.name: Burning pizza dough

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve only tried it 3 times. First time the pizza literally caught fire. The other two times, the pizza was over done on one side, but not enough on the other. Still trying to perfect it.
review.name: So Far No Good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I tired but the pizzas never come out well. Is there a level a skill required to make a good Ooni pizza.
review.name: How do I use this

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this as a gift, and I'll admit I was dreading my first attempt at making a pizza. But setup and using my Koda 12 was so easy and our three pizzas turned out pretty great. I'll definitely play with the heat settings more (think I got too hot toward my last pizza of the night) and graduate from premade rolled refrigerated dough when I've got more time to devote to it, but I can see my family enjoying this on a regular basis.
review.name: Really easy to use from the first try

review.reviewBody:
I feel compelled to write this review because of how much I love my Koda.
I've never really had a failure, but there is a slight learning curve. There are lots of videos on you tube to get you started. 
Except on the coldest days mine reaches temp in about 20 minutes. Thats just about the time it takes to prep the Pizza. I hand rotate about every 25 seconds and in four turns its done. I've used mine about three times a week in the past three years and it still looks and performs like brand new.
review.name: My favorite cooking appliance ever.

review.reviewBody:
It took me a while to perfect pizzas out of this oven. First, preheat for 30 minutes. Stone is not hot enough in 15 minutes. Second, add a 1/4” valve at the oven connection so you can actually turn the flame down enough once the top is almost done,
so the bottom can finish cooking. The valve on the oven will not allow a low temperature. Before I added the valve, I would turn off the oven when the top was done, and let it sit to finish the bottom. Make’s better pizza than anyone in my area.
review.name: Add a valve for better flame control

name: Koda 12in Gas Powered Pizza Oven

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is lightweight and provides great warm. The bomber-style design is cool and great for your casual day-to-day.
review.name: Great Casual Bomber Style Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Jacket seems nice. It has the same Patagonia quality you’d expect. I have a nano puff I’ve been wearing for years and absolutely love it. I like the water/wind resistance and wet weather protection with the synthetic insulation of the nano puff. Wanted to pick up a second Patagonia synthetic jacket but didn’t wanna pay full price for another nano puff (also wanted something with a hood but didn’t want to pay nearly 300 dollars for the nano puff hoodie.) This jacket seems a little less warm than the nano puff but that’s perfect for me since I run hot anyway. I think this jacket will fit into my early spring/fall wardrobe very nicely. Seems like it will work well for 40s to 50s and a light drizzle which is pretty much everyday here in nw Washington state. The only thing I do not like about it is the bottom of the jacket is a little bit too tight but I guess that’s just because it’s a bomber style. I run between a small and a medium (5’6 145 lbs) and the small fit me nicely. Still had enough room for a hoodie or a flannel underneath. Also worked well under a Gore-Tex shell.
review.name: Good for pnw late winter/early spring

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like the color and style but runs really big. I normally wear M on the jacket and I've had Patagonia in the past and that runs true to size. The sleeves are way too wide. I might have it exchanged for a S.
review.name: Nice but runs big

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Fit is strange as maybe even the size small is designed to comfortably fit someone with a large pot belly, but also extends equally out on the back side - as if a water balloon shape? If you don't mind a big amount of fabric extending on the front and back (unless perfectly pulled down - that's the only way I could have it not poof out...), then it's fine.
Bummed as it's well made and perfect warmth for me - just a strange cut and shape.
review.name: wanted to love it

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this for my son who never wore a jacket or coat before this even in our Chicago winters. He hasn’t taken this jacket off. It’s perfectly lightweight and warm enough to use for moderate cold temps. Also can be easily stowed in a backpack while at school. Great jacket!
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ordered this for my husband after Christmas. It came quick and fits great but there is an oil stain on the pocket that goes across the entire pocket. It looks like it was worn, returned and then shipped to me
review.name: Stain on pocket

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I live in the Pacific NW and I bought this jacket for fall and spring weather. it's warmer than I thought it'd be but that's not a bad thing. I am 5'9" and weigh 185lbs and I bought a large. It's a decent fit - a little more room in the arms and torso than i was expecting but I'm good with wearing sweatshirts underneath the jacket when it gets really cold. Overall a decent purchase.
review.name: I like it.

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a jacket for my early AM workouts.  This jacket is perfect, very light weight and warm but not too warm to be exercising. Blocks the wind well too. I bought it a size larger, I like the extra room, but also so I can just add a layer on colder days. Highly recommend.
review.name: Perfect Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fits true to size and great for cool temperatures. My husband wears this everyday to work and loves it! Diamond quilted pattern makes it stand out from other versions.
review.name: Great Jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: After using the previous reviews and sizing guide the jacket was a perfect fit. Great material.
review.name: Perfect Fit!

name: Diamond Quilted Bomber Hooded Jacket - Men's

hasVariant.name: Static V Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit Static V Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: They've been in use for maybe 6-8 nights total and both (we own 2) sprung a very similar leak the same night at one of the "welds". We were able to patch one successfully, but the other kid slept on the ground for our last night out. Light and small, but if it springs a leak - useless.
review.name: Works, but not that durable
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: The thing was cozy and I slept like a baby. The only 2 things were that it was a pain to pack in a hurry (at first), and that it was too big to fit into my issued bivy cover. The former issue was simply remedied by forgoing the stuff sack included and simply either throwing it in a bag, or wrapping it in 550 or elastic cord. The fitting issue wasn't the product's fault, as it is the "long" variant. I definitely plan to order a standard length one before the next field exercise; the thing made falling and staying asleep in weird sleeping spots easy. Word of warning, double check that the valve to let the air out is closed, before you try to start filling; it's common sense, you say, but it happens.
review.name: Slept like a baby

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great little sleeping pad. I use it for work and it allows me comfortable and quality sleep!
review.name: Great little sleeping pad

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great little sleeping pad. I use it for work and it allows me comfortable and quality sleep!
review.name: Great little sleeping pad

review.reviewBody:
I'm not critiquing the quality of the build, of which I have no doubt or experience to rate.
I found the pad was too minimal for comfort. I tried pad out on an un-carpeted floor and found that while it did pad me (6'1" 170lb side sleeper) without bottoming out, it felt precarious and unsatisfactory by itself. I think it has to do with the small volume of air, so with my weight it becomes highly compressed and firm, with no give (more air would have more room to distribute the weight and allow for springiness). Inflating it less wasn't an option as the line between "inflated" and "not" was paper thin. When I added a roll of closed cell foam underneath I felt less uneasy about damaging it, but no more supported. As a topper for a cot I could see it making a lot more sense, it is breathable and compact. Or for someone who doesn't need much cushion (like a back sleeper who's used to just using a foam roll) and wants a lightweight option it might be just what they're looking for.
review.name: Too minimal for me, maybe ideal for some

review.reviewBody:
So far so good. I haven't used it in the cold yet but it's held up so far. Found my kid jumping on it and no leaks, so far it's sturdy. 
I like the width and thickness- I am a stomach and side sleeper. I do wish I bought a bag inflator or the usb pump. It's not fun to blow up but it's also not terrible. 
Packs up small as well.
review.name: Great pad for a great price

review.reviewBody: Nice feature with the separate valves for intake and exhaust.
review.name: Nice feature with the separate

review.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite sleep pads so far. It is lightweight, packs up to the size of a pop can, and works perfectly well for my size (I'm 5' 5"). I've been a Klymit user for years and this particular model is my favorite so far. I recommend it for backcountry backpackers, for sure.
review.name: Perfect fit for those on the shorter side

review.reviewBody: bought this to see how it would do rather than an under quilt for a hammock. worked perfectly.
This pad was very lightweight, yet durable for my backcountry hunting trip and made a huge difference in the sleep I got. It was very easy to setup and takedown.

name: Static V Sleeping Pad

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these shorts, I absolutely love them. The elastic waistband is so comfortable. The pockets are in the perfect position. The length is spot on for with or without knee pads. I wear these on every from DH park laps to Sunday gravel rides with my wife. They’re the best.
review.name: The best MTB shorts

review.reviewBody:
I wear 34 w quicksilver these fit perfect and have just the right amount of stretch for riding. Heck these could become my favorite hanging out short. My inseam is 34 just over knee, “not shorties”
I Want More!
